body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Be The FABULOUS Voice Of Great Green Cleaning and Concierge Services!

Front Desk Admin/ Phone Sales/ 
THIS IS NOT YOUR AVERAGE JOB
And you are not the average employee. 
You are Unique, Committed, with an old fashioned work ethic.

Please read this entire ad before you choose to call,

SEVERAL POSITIONS AVAILABLE AT A GROWING PARK SLOPE BROOKLYN BASED EARTH FRIENDLY CLEANING COMPANY AND CONCIERGE SERVICE

We are open 7am to 10pm, 7 days per week- 
we have night and weekend shifts available.

Currently we are seeking Front Desk Sales/Customer Service staff  FT and P/T 
for Nights and weekends, and some mornings.


You are
Compassionate, Intelligent, Strong, Reliable, Smart   open to new things and wanting to learn.

Our front desk is like AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL at Kennedy, 
and is at the center of our company.

It's vital that you are able to think quickly on your feet, and not "lose your cool".  

Our Front Desk is the Voice of our Company -- The first point of contact with our clients, and our staff. You understand the importance of this and know that your voice and demeanor represents who we are.
New clients make the decision to trust us and use our services based on their connection with you. That's why you smile and are genuinely present and connecting when answering the phone.

You are conscious, kind, intelligent, professional, out-spoken, supportive, non judgmental, open minded a great listener, a great communicator, a great mediator, an excellent writer/proofreader, a good logistical thinker, computer literate and internet savvy. You are a self starter who likes to take on and complete projects, you're well spoken, considerate of others, a person of integrity, reliable, honest; you have a solid back bone and have no problem telling people the truth and holding them to their commitments as well as keeping your own. You have great customer service skills and basic sales skills; you're a caretaker and can help people make decisions about their cleaning needs.

You treat your work place as if you are the owner, and really care deeply about what you do and with whom you work.

You are the person that people come to when they need someone to talk to, who really knows how to listen!! You connect well in person and over the phone and have an interest in psychology, self-actualization and personal growth.

You'll be spending time on the phone with our existing clientele as well as new customers, and you are willing to be flexible and enthusiastic when taking on new tasks.
Your desire to learn and expand your professional skill set is key. 

People like to come to work with us! If we are going to spend 35 or more hours together every week --we want to enjoy what we do -- and with whom we work, don't you? We are a small, established and still growing, green cleaning company based in Brooklyn NY with over 50 highly trained cleaning specialists in the field, who travel using mass transit to service our clients in all five boroughs of New York City as well as parts of New Jersey. You must have good Google Map skills and be able to guide people to their Job-Sites. 

As a member of our Front Desk Support team you will be responsible for acting as a liaison between the clients and our cleaning specialists, as well as a liaison between our customer service department and both new and old clients. Some tasks include but are not at all limited to:

Ensuring all members of our cleaning staff is aware of and informed of the full details of their daily assignments, in a clear and connecting way.

Making sure our supplies are filled and in good order and preparing supply kits for our cleaning staff to bring on assignments with them as requested by customers, and making sure equipment is functioning well. This requires some lifting and moving of equipment up to 50 pounds.

Providing travel directions for our cleaning staff to and from job locations as needed,  a familiarity with Google Maps is important.

Processing credit card authorizations for new clients

Maintaining accurate clock in and clock outs for our cleaning staff and customers.

Sounding amazing and connecting on each phone call and directing incoming phone calls to the proper department for customer service and in-house support.

Ensuring all jobs have valid contracts, payment information, and cleaning specialists assigned to them. Handling all logistical details for each job.

Speaking to new clients about their cleaning needs and helping them decide which services to purchase.

Speaking to prospective employees and screening them for experience and knowledge, making sure that they are a fit for our company.

Lovingly, providing emotional support for each Cleaning Specialist.

General Administrative support for the Management team and the Client Care staff,


All front desk support team members are required to have:

High school diploma/GED equivalence
3+ years office experience in a support capacity
Computer literacy
Customer Service/Mediation experience
Excellent Verbal and written communication skills, and write excellent business letters.
You must be well spoken and know the difference between Ask and Ax
Experience with a multi-line phone system.


An intermediate knowledge of Microsoft applications such as MS Word, MS Excel and Power point.

Your cover letter IS MORE IMPORTANT than your resume.
Please take care - and show us who you are.

Great job-  if you are returning to work, great job if you are a student and need a flexible schedule, great job if  you are writing a novel and need a P/T job until you are published. Easy if you live in Brooklyn or in Park Slope and you can walk or bike to work.


Call us for an interview and let us hear how amazing you are!
718-369-9000

Or email your resume to :
hr@greatgreencleaning.com

Thank you for taking the time to read this,
we look forward to meeting you!

Human Resources

Please feel free to explore our mission and vision and our website
www.GreatGreenCleaning.com

If you made it to the bottom of this ad,
use the secret code -  I AM WELL READ  when you apply - for extra credit!



AA/EOE
Great Green Cleaning is committed to provide equal opportunity, employment, and advancement opportunities to all individuals. Great Green Cleaning does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, State, or Local Laws.

NYC Based IT Consulting and Managed Services Firm seeking a full time Help Desk Tech who will handle both remote and  onsite support for clients.

You will work with great clients and other technical staff, and have the opportunity to grow your own skills.   

Please review the included job requirements and skill qualifications, and if you feel that meet this criteria, submit your resume for review.  We would like to hear something unique about you, so please share that with your resume and cover letter.  If selected, we will reach out to you to start the process.   There is a technical interview, so please be sure you can back up your skills during the interview process.   Qualified candidates only need apply. 

Requirements:

Must be knowledgeable in the following areas and willing to take a technical test, background check and credit check.

 Strong Desktop Skills a Must - Windows 10, 8, and Windows 7 Professional a must.
 Strong Hardware Troubleshooting Skills a Must 
 Microsoft Certification a Plus

 Basic Server Experience a Plus - Windows 2012, 2008
 - Ability to set up user accounts and grant permissions
 - General server administration
- Hardware troubleshoot when necessary

Business software suites such as MS-Office
Mac Experience a Plus
Office 365 Experience a Plus

Familiarity with Cloud Technologies such as Office 365, Citrix Sharefile, Dropbox, Google Services and similar services is a plus, but not required
iPhones, Droids, Blackberries and other PDA Phones that link to Exchange and other email services.
Ipads and Tablets
Printers, Scanners, Network Copiers and other computer peripheral devices.
Troubleshoot fast and efficiently. 
Ability to write well, and communicate effectively with clients.
Ability to work in a team environment and share information
Strong customer service experience will make  you a front runner!!

 Connectwise Experience a Plus
 RMM tools Experience a Plus

 Must be self starter and be a 'people person'.
 Must be able to put in additional hours if needed for special projects
 Send Resume if Interested

If you've reviewed the attached and feel that you are qualified for the position, please send your resume for prompt review.  Please include a cover letter, or some bullet items indicating why you are suited for this position. Please include salary requirements. Only submissions with requested information will be considered.  This position is immediately available.

Please provide your resume, cover letter and salary requirements to move you quickly through the screening process.  We look forward to hearing from you!

PLEASE APPLY USING THE ONLINE APPLICATION FORM BELOW.

We are seeking a bright, organized, cheerful person to be an integral part of a busy high-end plastic surgery practice on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. Our plastic surgeon is highly-rated, well-respected, and has a strong media presence.

The ideal candidate will be:
-a college graduate
-interested in the beauty industry
-interested in luxury sales/ luxury goods
-have a basic working knowledge of health, wellness, and doctor's offices
-facile in social media
-able to think on her/ his feet
-a nice, friendly people person
-discreet about sensitive topics

Your duties will include:
-fielding phone calls and inquiries from new patients
-receptionist/ secretary/ personal assistant duties
-fulfilling skin care orders & managing skin care customer service
-talking to clients about skin care products
-developing creative content (blogs, photos, etc) of skin care products
-working with celebrities and influencers regarding skin care products
-scheduling new patients
-talking to patients
-assisting with administrative responsibilities
-assistance during office hours
-basic computer/ web tasks

Minimum work hours would be: Monday-Friday 12pm-6pm, with an option for more hours

Perks include:
-opportunities to use your creativity with blog, instagram, facebook, and twitter posts
-opportunities to try skincare and beauty treatments
-opportunities to attend media events and parties
-possible conversion of this job into a more senior position

To apply for this job, please complete our online application here:

https://www.cognitoforms.com/UpperEastSidePlasticSurgeon1/PlasticSurgeryOfficeApplication

Please note that the only way to apply for this job is via the above link. Please do not email your CV and cover letter-- the link above will give you an opportunity to upload them.

Candidate must have experience in the Home base Day Care industry or related.

- Candidate must have the following qualifications and skills:

*excellent personality 
*cleanliness 
*excellent organizational skills 
*creative with daily curriculums  including Arts & Crafts
*multi-task able to work with different age groups simultaneously 
*RELIABLE / punctual. Must be on time.
*Must be able to work independently. However, must also be a Team player. 
*Must have a take charge personality where you can deal with parents and children. 

**MUST have love and Patience for Children...please don't call if you don't! 


******EXPERIENCE IN CHILD CARE A MUST*********

**15-30hr. Health & Safety Training Certification REQUIRED** 

DUTIES: 
*Must be able to teach the basic fundamentals. 
*Will be responsible for the Health and Safety of all children. 
*Light administrative duties required. 
*Able to bring knowledge and enthusiasm for learning 
*Very Creative with daily activities and curriculum including Arts & Crafts 
*Follow daily routine and Day Care rules and regulations. 
*Daily cleaning of space required 
*Communicating with families in an effective , curious and friendly manner on a daily basis .
*Cook, prepare and serve meals for children.



*  Must be 18 years of age, or older. Must be able to pass an extensive background check , fingerprinting, scr clearance and medical clearance.

All persons interested in summer camp counselor must have experience working with kids in a summer camp. Employee references are a MUST. No personal references.

FULL-TIME Hrs. 7:30am - 7:30pm

IF THIS JOB IS SUITABLE FOR YOU AND YOU'RE LOOKING FOR A LONG TERM EMPLOYMENT PLEASE INQUIRE WITHIN, BY CALLING 516-668-1426

*No Recruiters please. Only persons fitting above criteria with necessary experience need apply.

*** Full/Part Time positions are available immediately.***
** PLEASE STATE EXPECTED COMPENSATION IN EMAIL.****

While we appreciate your interest only those under consideration will be given email to send resume after phone interview.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We're a full service marketing company which specializes in sms/text message marketing services for local (brick and mortar) businesses. (We do a lot of work with bars and restaurants.) 

We need one person to do lead generation ONLY. This position is expected to acquire qualified sales leads in the form of contact information for the owner/decision maker of local neighborhood businesses.  If hired, you will be trained to follow an established program that will help determine which businesses are the best candidates to successfully benefit from the Local Mobile Text Message (SMS) Marketing solution.  Candidates for this position must be friendly, professional,  confident and outgoing self-starters.

**Hours are flexible, but this is NOT a phone position.** Prior hospitality and/or sales experience is a strong plus but not required.  The position starts right away,  is part time and the first month is a trial period. Bonuses are available in future months for the candidate that shows promise.  This is rather easy money for the right person, and there's possibilities in the future for residual income as well. 

The right candidate will be trained in one, 90 minute session. You'll be expected to enter all leads into our CRM. (We use https://www.insightly.com/) This is absolutely required.  We prefer businesses in NYC, but if you are in Brooklyn, Queens, Hoboken, etc. . .anywhere where there's a high concentration of places you can visit in a short time, we can chat. 

Appropriate venues include bars, clothing stores, nail salons, beauty salons, small coffee shops, pizza places, restaurants, etc. This is all about helping the small to mid size business owner--typically the people who need it the most. 

This is a perfect "add on" opportunity to whatever else it is you're doing and can lead to possible (part time) employment.  People who reply will be directed to a very short form which further explains the position and will allow you to complete the application process if you choose to do so. 

**There is no need to respond with a resume to this posting.** You can always upload one if you choose to continue on to the application form. 

**WE'RE LOOKING FOR ONE PERSON TO START ASAP.**

This position will be exclusively administrative work and will be creating prospecting lists on excel.  

Someone who will gain a lot from this experience will be someone who, through their observation skills, learns what skills are needed are needed to be a financial advisor and what it is like to work in the financial services industry.  

So, while creating prospecting lists, and at appropriate times, asking questions about the company, business, etc will be a good way to get the most out of the internship.

Expect 2 days per week, which will be flexible, probably about 12 hours a week.  In some cases, working remotely will be an option. You must be able to bring in a computer, preferably one that can connect via an Ethernet cord.  People generally work in the position for about 8-10 weeks, however one can continue to work as long as it makes sense.

The skills via observation you perceive will be: 
-selling
-marketing
-entrepreneurship
-time management skills
-organization

Ideally is someone looking to bolster their resume so people who have been in this role in the past have been students, recently college grads, however that is not a prerequisite.

Thank you for your interest and I look forward to working with you and helping you get meaningful career experience for your future goals.
title: Part-Time Intern to Financial Advisor

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Sci-fi bar comic book, free retro video game themed restaurant is looking to hire 3 employees.  Please reply with what job you're interested in your email and answer the questions at the bottom.

Three restaurant jobs available:
1. Cashier job with managing, food handliers license & bartending experience a plus. This job is full time. 
2. Cashier with bartender, managing, food handliers a plus.  Full time. 
3. Line cook assistant, food kitchen preppier and back up bike delivery person. Experience not required, but it does help. This is a part time entry level position. Read more details below at the bottom. Answer the questions at the bottom of job 3. 

JOBS 1 and 2:
Requirements: 
1. Cashier/managing job.  Bartending experience a plus.  (Job 1)
2. Cashier job.  Bartending & managing experience a plus.   (Job 2)
3. Food handlers license required. * If you don't have, you can get while working on the job.  
4. Reading the restaurant's sci-fi books required for both jobs.  Can read while on the job. 


These are the hours for both jobs: 

Job 1: Monday off. Tuesday off. Wednesday off. Thursday 1pm-1:30am. Friday 1pm-2am Saturday 1pm-1am.  Sunday 1pm-1:30am.  (If 12 hour shifts are too much for you, don't bother replying).

Job 2: Monday 3:30pm-1:30am. Tuesday 3:30pm-1:30am. Wednesday off. Thursday off. Friday 7pm-4:30am. Saturday 7pm-4:30am. Sunday off. 

We are a sci-fi bar, comic book, free retro video game themed restaurant and we are looking for experienced, open minded, ambitious, trustworthy, multitasking, excellent people skills and a hard working employee, looking to work. We have been open for 6 years, but closed for construction last summer.  Restaurant is split into two parts. Comic book themed one side (comics and video games) and sci-fi bar themed. The bar is the first of it's kind built. A sci-fi bar with led lights everywhere and glowing onyx bar top. Bar area will be very busy. Restaurant has 1000s of video games for customers to play for free. 

Fun exciting DREAM job here! We have sci-fi/comic movies on all the time, hundreds of video games (nintendo, super smash, arcades games) to play on your break, free meals, flexible schedules and tons of comics to read. We have our own science fiction novel series and comic book implemented into the restaurant theme. Job is laid back and easy to learn.  

Friday & Saturday nights from 8pm-4am are Nintendo Jazz nights on the comic side. 
Friday & Saturday nights from 8pm-4am are DJ sci-fi. R & B Remixes from 80s-00s on sci-fi bar side. 
Jello shot machine and virtual pin ball coming this summer. 

APPLICANTS:

- Must be good with following directions and following rules.
- Must be open to learning different areas of the restaurant, prepping food, bagging/wrapping orders and learning the kitchen.
- Must have years experience working as a cashier and working with a pos system.
- Must have a wonderful personality and get along with others (customers, boss and co-workers).
- Must know how to follow store's policy and rules/regulations.
- Must be a team player.
- Must have excellent customer service skills.
- Have excellent problem solving skills.
- Be a good decision maker.
-Okay with working 12 hour shifts. 
- Required to read the restaurant's sci-fi books.
- Into cos-play.
- FOOD HANDLERS LICENSE required.  Can get while working on the job. 

JOB DESCRIPTION

Your job will be servicing customers, taking orders on the POS system then bringing customers their food (no waitress service), taking orders over the phone, dealing with online delivery services, managing/supervising delivery person, staying on top of customer table area (Checking/refilling napkins, wiping tables, cleaning small bathroom if needed, refilling ketchup on tables, cleaning after your shift and properly closing/opening the store). Checking inventory list and filling cashier area. Cashier will also be responsible for filling sodas when delivery people aren't working.

Smiling and greetings customers is very important, along with having excellent customer service skills. Asking customers how was their food and saying goodbye when they leave is very important.

Job also includes: making milkshakes (we make alot of milkshakes here), interacting with customers, making sure video game systems are on correct screen, communicating with cook, giving out milkshake samples,  cleaning, sweeping, moping, wiping tables, staying on top of food list, inventory, organizing deliveries, properly communicating with delivery customers, asking to take photos of customers while eating, cleaning bar areas, sometimes giving out food menus when it's slow, assisting cook with prepping food if needed (only when super busy), someone willing to learn the basics of the kitchen and constantly communicating with owner of any issues.

Candidates/hires are required to read restaurant's science fiction novels BIO-Sapien series and future series, because the books are apart of the restaurant's theme and they are for sale at the restaurant. This is very important for cashiers/managers/bartenders since they will be upsaling and pitching the books to customers. Commission for book sales will be setup with each sale on a cashier's shift. Customers will be asking staff what is the series is about and cashiers/managers must know. Sandwich names, drink names and science technologies are named after the characters in the series.


FUTURE:
Name tags and restaurant tee shirts will be required in the future for wearing.

PLUS:

Managing experience, comic book experience, into Anime, hosting anime meetups, into Karaoke, hosting events, into science fiction/fantasy, cooking experience and natural leaderships are all pluses.

Bartending - 

Not required for job, but is definetly a plus if you have exp. We have a full bar, but candidates can learn on the job.  We have a drinks list with instructions on how to make every liquor and milkshake we sell.   Bartending experience helps with making more tips since you'll have the capacity to make other drinks not on our drinks mcnu.
Karaoke will be on during happy hour during the week (if you like Karaoke and can sing with customers, that will be a big plus).
Tips are good in Williamsburg. 

Salary - This is a salaried position plus tips (similar to a shift pay). 
Job 1: Salaried/shift pay $400-$475 (depending on experience) a week plus tips.
Job 2: Salaried/shift pay $330-$400 (depending on experience) a week plus tips. 

Cashier/bartenders average $75-$125 in tips a day on the weekend (they have their own tip jar that isn't shared).  With salaried pay and tips, employees average $12-$17 an hour. Restaurant started online reservation seating with a 15% auto gratuity for groups (this would be split with the bartenders/cashier).  

FINALLY:

***(Job 1 &2) If you are interested and you FULLY read this ad, please reply with your resume, job experience, what separates you from other candidates, references, what job you're interested in? and include a cover letter to why you think you are the perfect candidate for this position.

Please answer these questions when you reply:

0. Which job number are you interested in? 
1. Have you ever been to the comic con?
2. Have you ever dressed up in costume?
3. Are you looking for long term or short term position?  
4. Does this look like a dream job to you? 
5. Can you send a photo of yourself in cos-play or dressed up? 
6. How much managing experience do you have? 
7. Are you working now? If not, why did you leave your last job? 
8. Do you have bartending experience? If so, what is your experience?  What is your favorite drink to make? 
9. Do you like comics and or sci-fi? Are you willing to read the restaurant's sci-fi books? 
10. Are you okay with working till 4am on the weekend?
11. Are you interested in hosting anime meetups and organizing events? (Karoke nights, super smash bros tournaments, etc). 
12. Do you have marketing experience with facebook, instragram and twitter?
13. What do you think of the photos posted of the bar and restaurant in this ad? 
14. Do you have your food handlers license? 
15. What separates you from other applicants interested in this job? 
16. Is money your #1 priority for this job? 
17. Have you worked 12 hour shifts before?  Can you handle working these amount of hours at once? 
18. Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
19. Do you speak any other languages besides english? 

Feel free to ask any questions.
____________________________________________________________

JOB 3:   Part time - Kitchen preppier, cook assistant and backup delivery person. No experience required, but previous kitchen/restaurant experience is a plus. 

Are you looking  to learn the basics of the kitchen and looking to get your foot in the door at a restaurant? Don't have much experience and looking for a part time job?  Want to learn line cooking, but don't have any experience? This might be the job for you. 

This is an entry level job for learning and working in the back end of a fast pace restaurant. This is a fast food burger restaurant.  That makes 75-100 burgers a day. 
Job description: Learning to prep burgers (measuring, slapping and forming shape), filling up sauces, cutting vegetables (tomatoes, lettuce, onions, etc), cutting chicken breast, prepping bacon on the grill, cleaning deep fryer, washing dishes, dressing sandwiches, help with orders, using the deep frier, learning to read line order tickets, learning the basics of the grill, cleaning, getting food from downstairs, helping with milkshakes/drinks, bringing food to tables, collecting empty baskets and collecting garbage. 
You'll also be a backup delivery person.  Friday and Saturday between 11pm-2am and Sunday evening we get a rush of deliveries. You will assist the current delivery person.  Having your own bike is a plus, if not we have a backup bike for you to use.  

Requirements: Fast on your feet, must have a working phone with GPS, know how to ride a bike, being a quick learning, getting along well with others, hard worker, must be able to lift 50-75lbs, have good hygiene and is a team player.  

Hours:  Wednesday 12pm-6pm. Friday 11pm-4:30am. Saturday 11pm-4:30am. Sunday 3pm-8pm.
Pay: $11 an hour PLUS TIPS. $11 an hour plus tips comes out to $13-$15 an hour. 

If interested in this job, reply with a resume if you have (if not, that's fine) and answer these questions:

Have you worked at a restaurant in the kitchen before?  if so, what did you do? 
Why are you interested in this job? 
What separates you from other candidates?
Are you looking to grow with the business into other positions?
Where do you see yourself in 10 years? 
What other languages do you speak? 
Have you made deliveries before? 
Tell me something about yourself?
Are you in school now?
Are you working somewhere else now?

Tap Into The Revolution: As a Call9 team member, you will operate at the nexus of clinical excellence, engineering innovation and progressive enterprise amongst a culture that fosters ingenuity and education. Ready to learn more?...Tap In!

About Call9: Call9 is breaking the mold of traditional Emergency Medicine and telemedicine while reinventing 911. Our patient-centered proprietary telemedicine platform connects off-site emergency physicians with on-site emergency medicine trained Clinical Care Specialists (CCS). Call9 provides a spectrum of emergency care services at the patient's bedside in skilled nursing facilities.

Position Summary: The Medical Billing and Coding Coordinator will be responsible for the operational aspects of the revenue cycle at Call9. This person will be the point of contact for any discrepancies, insight, and data regarding Medical Billing and Payments.  This person will assist the Payor Relations team by ensuring accuracy in coding and billing for our medical procedures.  They will review and manage the claims and payments made by our health insurance payers.  They will also run reports and dashboards to provide information for our team to make strategic and tactical decisions around the revenue cycle.

Responsibilities:

- Billing and coding our Telehealth program 
- Actively engaged in the development of ongoing clinical utilization and expansion of Telehealth services 
- Develops and maintains policies and procedures that ensures compliance and mitigates risk 
- Keeps abreast of annual updates and changes to CPT & ICD codes and is knowledgeable of applicable regulations and funding opportunities as well as standards to aid staff in achieving compliant documentation
- Accurately bill invoices and payments
- Generates and provides reports that provide data for our Payor Relations team
- Point of contact for any discrepancies, insight, and data regarding Medical Billing and Payments
- Including following up with payor on any identified payment issues
- Research, correct, and resubmit or reprocess unpaid claims as necessary
- Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals
- Provide leadership to others through example and sharing of knowledge/skill
- Analyzes and reviews payments for claims prior to release to payors for approval or denial
- Assist with additional documentation, follow up with claims
- Ability to work independently and motivated to develop opportunities
- Ability to resolve conflicts and/or negotiate with others to achieve positive results; establish and maintain effective interpersonal relations
- Must work well in a team environment and have excellent customer service skills
- Strong work ethic and the ability to strive in a fast-paced work environment

Qualifications: 
- 2-3 years of medical coding and billing experience required
- Medical Billing Certification preferred
- Experience with ICD-10 coding required
- Preferred Experience working with third-party insurance companiesPreferred Emergency Department billing experience 

Education: 
- Bachelor's Degree Required 
- CPC and/or CCS Required

Call9 provides equal opportunity in employment for all qualified persons and prohibits discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, perceived sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability unrelated to job requirements, genetic information, military service, or other protected status as may be mandated by applicable Federal, State and local law. All personnel actions, including but not limited to those relating to compensation, benefits, termination, training and education, are based on the principle of equal employment opportunity.

Based in Dumbo, Brooklyn, our award-winning firm has been in business for over 30 years and is seeking a talented, team-spirited individual to work on hospitality and high-end residential design projects. We are an international boutique, full-service design-consulting firm specializing in architecture, interior design, custom furniture design and branding. We blend interior and environmental design and brand development to create experiences that inspire and stimulate the senses. We approach each project, from luxury yachts to the development of global brands and revolutionary hospitality ventures, with a holistic design methodology. With innovation as its bedrock, our firm delivers cutting edge design with an eye for elegance and style.

The firm is seeking a responsible, self-motivated experienced architect for immediate, full-time employment. We are looking for an individual who is not only CAD-proficient and detail-oriented, but who also listens to and contributes to a creative design dialogue, and who likes to experiment with new ideas and materials. The candidate must be able to take direction and as well as work independently as needed. They will also need to be a team player and take responsibility for work assigned. Curiosity, resourcefulness and self-motivation are also essential.

Responsibilities include collaborating with the firm's principal and designers in all aspects of project design, construction documentation and site work. Applicants should demonstrate a strong design sensitivity and thoroughness in drawing and project organization that is commensurate with highly customized high-end projects. This will include drafting of projects, picking up red lines, permit drawings and shop drawings. The position requires communicating on a daily basis via phone calls and emails with our clients, professional consultants, fabricators, site labor and sub-contractors.

Persons interested must also have the following requirements:

•	5-10 years' experience and professional degree in Architecture
•	Extensive experience of all stages of project development: SD, DD, CD and CA
•	Project Management of 2-3 projects simultaneously
•	Extensive experience in coordination of MEP, Structure and other consultants such as lighting designers, landscape architects, etc.
•	Site/field work experience
•	Extensive experience reviewing submittals / shop drawings and RFIs
•	Highly motivated and organized with a strong understanding of the importance of office protocol and QM
•	Highly proficient in Auto-CAD and Revit
•	Extensive experience in both new-build and refurbishment projects
•	Ability to manage and lead design meetings with Ownership, Hotel Brand, General Contractor and all related consultants
•	Experience in large-scale hospitality design
•	Strong understanding and awareness of Hotel Brand Standards and the ability to incorporate into a design
•	Ability to multi-task, work on short time frames and meet tight deadlines
•	Strong ability to design and develop the finest of details as well as the 'bigger picture'
•	Must be proficient in putting together drawings sets, primarily in SD and DD
•	Strong written and verbal communication skills
•	Proactive mind set and the ability to think quickly and act on the spot 

Please submit your resume with salary expectations as well as portfolio of recent work in pdf format. Submissions that do not meet these requirements will be disregarded.

Tri-state candidates only - no international / out-of-area applicants.
title: Architect / Project Manager

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
MakiMaki is a one of a kind QSR in Midtown Manhattan. We offer quality sushi rolls, made fresh in front of customers, all at supermarket prices. Finally great sushi at affordable prices! Customers love us and we love our customers. Our team is a close knit group of 9 individuals, most of whom have been with the company since the opening in July. A few have joined along the way and we have had very little turnover.

We are currently looking to expand our close-knit team by hiring a starting position within the sushi assembly line. If you have experience working on a restaurant line, then you will find MakiMaki is a simple but engaging place to work. The hours will generally be from morning to evening (10:00 AM ~ 8:00 PM) and will be about 35 hours a week (starting). Depending on the candidate's appetite and growth, this could expand to additional hours

The primary role will be:

1) Manage the printer / orders
2) Prep rice for each type of sushi (simple)
3) Place fish onto rice
4) Roll, Cut, and Package
5) Managing inventory of prepped fish and rice
6) Communicating orders for additional fish and rice to kitchen downstairs

Candidates will be tested over 2 weeks to determine longterm qualification which will be based on.

1) Hard working
2) Team player
3) Honest

Please note there is LOTS OF ROOM FOR GROWTH. We have another key personal within our team who started off as a porter, but is now a crucial member of the sushi making team. I like to train my team members so they can take on multiple roles as opposed to just one.

If interested, please apply by providing a resume or brief writeup in addition to answering the following 3 simple questions. If no answers are provided, then candidate will automatically be disqualified.

1) 2+3=?
2) An example in your work history when you went out of your role to help another out. 
3) What do you expect to get from a job other than financial compensation?
4) Are you working to help someone else?

Thanks

Kevin

 IF YOU HAVE A CAR, CAN WORK FULL TIME AND HAVE EXPERIENCE, plz text Jennifer now 917-892-1421 with your full name, Monday to Sunday am to pm availabilities and Jennifer will call either today or tomorrow. 

 If you don't have a car, PLEASE DON'T CALL US, BUT please email us with Monday to sunday am to pm availabilities, homany years of experience or no experience(we can train) asap. 

SERIOUS APPLICATIONS ONLY. PLZ ONLY REPLY IF YOU ARE SERIOUSLY INTERESTED AND CAN WORK ASAP AS MANY DAYS AS YOU CAN. IMMEDIATE HIRE.

Job Type: Full-time is strongly preferred but part time can apply. 

Cleaners who have full availability, get us repeat customers, get 5 star reviews from clients will get more jobs and will be paid more. Also if you do great job,you will get more tips. We will pay either per hour or flat rates depending how quick and detailed you clean. You will be quickly promoted if you perform exactly we and clients ask and you can also be a manager. NY manager needs to go other states to open more businesses.

Cleaning needs a focus, but it is easy to learn. some people are naturally talented. We had a 18 year old who had no experience but after we worked with him only 3 hours,on the 2nd cleaning he went by himself, he got us 5 star. He got good tip too.

plz first visit all pages of

1hourmaid911.com

and understand which types of services we provide.

plz also introduce your friends and family who have experience and a car. 

ABOUT THE JOB:

This cleaning position requires you to go to clean/organize on the same day 50% of the time because we specialize in same day services, usually within few hours--that's what we specialize, EMERGENCY CLEANING SERVICE.

For cleaners who has a car, pick up and drop off the manager from Williamsburg, Brooklyn NY and clean with her(and sometimes also with other cleaners for a big jobs) get paid more than cleaners who travel by subways and busses, so THE REQUIREMENT IS TO PICK HER UP AND DROP HER OFF, THE MOST OF TIME.

When you go by yourself, we will send information such as address, details of cleaning, pictures if available and price we will pay and you can pick the jobs which you want to do.

You can be at home or anywhere as long as you let us know what time exactly you can be at clients' houses and be there on time. You will need to have a google map, camera and email on a cell phone.

We will do background checks and we hire only people with no criminal records. And you will have to agree to the rules and agree not to steal our clients.

House/restaurants/hotels/offices/other commercial deep and basic cleaning, organizing

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Green Grass Real Estate is a brokerage located in Bronxville, New York, and the owner is looking for a personal assistant to help her with all kinds of tasks.  While the majority of those tasks will be admin-related for the brokerage, other duties and responsibilities for this position can run the gamut on any given day. One day you might be researching events around Westchester to input into a spreadsheet, another day you might be creating marketing flyers on canva or powerpoint, and other days might be filled booking plane tickets for a family vacation or re-arranging family appointments.  As you can see, flexibility is key for this role. 

The must-have skills we are looking for are excellent computer/technology skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel, and the like.  A couple other must-have qualities would be good customer service and organizational skills.  If you already have experience at a real estate brokerage, that would be a HUGE plus but the most important thing is really your willingness to help tackle any task that affects the business. We can't stress enough how important this position is to the company. The more items that are taken off of the owner's name plate, the more she can focus on growing the company, which results in a growth in the salary for this position as well. 

This job will require a maximum of twenty-five (25) working hours per week Monday - Friday and we would like to have a consistent schedule beginning roughly at 9:30/10am each day.  After a while, we can revisit hours in the office and can likely be more accommodating. 

The initial salary will be $12/hour (which translates to just over $15,000/year and you will be paid twice per month (e.g., every 15th and 30th)).

After a month trial has been completed, your salary will be increased to $14/hour.

After the completion of your first year with the company, we will revisit the compensation structure.
Please be aware that no benefits (e.g., health insurance, vacation time, sick days, etc.) will be provided until the completion of your first year with the company when we can discuss that topic further.
 
We ask you to review the above information with care and only respond if you are amenable to everything as it has been described.

Please be sure to note that this is not a work from home position. 

Thank you for your interest!
title: Personal Assistant to busy owner of growing RE Brokerage

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We are seeking a dynamic and hard working sous chef to join our crew. Please be a chef who is well-rounded in classic techniques. Japanese experience would nice, but not absolutely necessary. What is absolutely necessary, is a true team player, one who works well with others, does not let ego fog your decisions, and takes direction or criticism like a champ. We all believe that this whole endeavor is a group effort; that our strength lies in our collaborative energies. We're looking for someone who likes working within systems as well as creating and enhancing existing systems. Be obsessed with the process.

This is a working chef's job and it requires a true sense of ownership. This restaurant is extremely busy. It is a prep-heavy environment with hundreds of covers a day, delivery, and a lot of moving parts. It is located in NYC, and has all the challenges associated with that fact. Please be a strong; teacher, mentor, and line cook whisperer. You should honestly believe that your success depends on the success of your team's training, and that your kitchen is only as strong as your weakest cook, or dishwasher. You should know how to get the most out of your team with a mixture of; kindness, respect, training, clear direction, and ass-kicking. It would also help if you have a healthy sense of humor, as you will surely need it.  

You will also work directly with ownership and upper management. You will be able to work with Ivan and learn how his culinary palate works; help create new menus, pop-ups, collabs, and grow with this company. The right person should look at this as an opportunity for exponential growth; we are looking for someone who is ready to commit to our team and the project. 

Although we are a small company we have strong systems that must be maintained, including HR paperwork, financial reporting, and costing. Please be comfortable working within a structure of professionalism and documentation.

Please reply with cover letter and resume. Tell us what sets you apart.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Staten Island residents only please. NYC is too far a drive from our NJ location

Text Dave the owner at 973 647 7769

There is nothing more reliable than Plumbing, Heating and Air conditioning, they can't export a trade to India! LOL!!! The sky is the limit, maybe even own your own company someday! Our last "Salsy" Tech cleared 120K two years running before moving out of state to start his own business. Between his regular hourly pay, overtime pay and bonus/reward money he averaged $52 hr!

HVAC Technician "Golden Ticket" Opportunity! The free training alone is worth tens of thousands of dollars and a career in this field can bring you hundreds of thousands of dollars over the years! We have the Best trucks, Best people, Paid training, Fastest career path and Compensation. We keep our HVAC Techs busy year round, because our people are crossed trained do basic plumbing calls too! (HVAC Techs in trucks with Lead Plumbers in slow season) Some even go on to receive their Master Plumbers license! 

If you lie, cheat, steal or do hard drugs, please skip further reading this Craig's list post, as it's not for you. However, if you truly live a clean lifestyle, have life goals and would like to enjoy the benefits of working with an elite team where honesty, organization and good character thrive, please read on!

Being a great communicator is a requirement. Diagnosing, selling, repairing and servicing residential equipment a must. Your current employer WILL NOT be contacted. At Good Tidings, we understand your desire to not waste time with interviews that are not likely to pan out. Why get dressed up and drive to a business location, only to spend even more time being paraded around the office? There's a better way!

With the convenience of your laptop, you can now "Interview" from the comfort and privacy of your home. If you want a career where you can make more money and leave the daily frustrations of your current job behind, then why not accept my invitation by clicking this link? http://goodtidings.applybyweb.com (Click the Technician / Plumber tab)

To get the most attention, text or call the owner at 973 647 7769 

Visit:
www.goodtidingscomfort.com
www.facebook.com/GoodTidingsComfort
https://youtu.be/fJRjZyjQfBA

We're currently searching for a great communicator who is interested in getting more out of life; more time off, more money, more career opportunity, more training, more support, more appreciation and more fulfillment. We are looking for someone who can appreciate the work/life balance that our company can deliver for them.

Quote from one employe:
"I started working a few months ago, came in with no experience and they welcomed me with opened arms. They are more than willing to teach and accommodate my learning curve. Everyone from the office to the warehouse and the Technicians are all a big family. The guys in the field really get along together, want to see each other succeed and its great to be around that environment. I enjoy working here; it's a real family atmosphere. Also, learning from these Technicians that are such masters or their craft is something to strive for!"
~ Steve P

Better yet, here is what Adam had to share:
Less than 2 years ago I started with Good Tidings and now I am on my way to becoming a full technician. I'm so excited, I just returned from a week of paid sales and customer service training in California and I'm looking forward to using my new skills! The motivation, training and pay increases come along with every step of the way, and you are most certainly not alone when help is needed because we are a team. All the technicians and office staff are like a second family and everyone is there to help out if the going gets tuff. I couldn't have pictured a better environment to learn and grow in this trade, and for that I am truly grateful. 
~ Adam M.

OK, this next part is ONLY for you Doubting Thomas's out there.

I've been hearing from some applicants lately who took years before reaching out to me. They were thinking the Craig's list ad was too good to be true and likely the work of a recruiter. A positive, straight forward, honest, cutting edge Plumbing, Heating and Air-conditioning company here in NJ? Applicants quickly expressed their relief after speaking with me and wished they'd reached out sooner, instead of wrongly thinking that the ad was the product of some scam. 

Worse yet, they might have been thinking I was like the big, unethical, money hungry, state wide, corporate owned, get away with whatever I can, "Teach and reward my people for lying", soon to be in the papers and speaking and with the Attorney General for ripping off the elderly, type of company (Can you tell how I feel just yet?).

In an effort to get ahead of these thoughts, please know that I am a very real family man, a 2nd generation Master Plumber, HVAC businessman and license holder. I built my company from scratch, and i care about my company, its people and my customers, enormously. 

I'm honest, ethical, integrity filled and unafraid. The cost of which, in the past, going through peak times with trucks sitting idle and the office turning lots of work away. Why turn all of that work and money away??? Because it was the right thing to do, in light of the lack of quality and character of the available workmen, which was way below what my customers expected and deserved for their hard-earned money. It's hard for most people to believe, but I value my faith and integrity above profits.

For you sceptics out there, I'm climbing out on a limb here, by sharing a very personal account of faith in the workplace. My goal is to put away any doubt or speculation out of your mind and have you see for yourself, what it's been like NOT to be held captive by money and to do the "right thing" in business, no matter what the cost. To God be the glory

https://youtu.be/BZZQkxULXAo

Honesty matters
~ Dave
29 years of faith filled family service!
title: HVAC Techs NOT getting enough hours? Up to $40 Hr. year round!

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Music promotion/PR company working with both local and international artists looking for casual quality freelance writers to write music features/reviews or short blog posts for our independent artists. We are only looking for writers who already contribute to a quality, medium or high traffic publication or blog, or can pitch features. Genres vary and all are high quality. We are looking for writers who have a true passion for honest, underground music like we do. Reviews are paid $10-$60 EACH depending on blog/publication audience. This is contract work meaning you could be sent anywhere from 1 - 10 artists per month. 

Reviews also should be your own opinion. They do not need to be positive. This must be an honest process. 

We are ALSO looking for social influencers who are interested in considering our artists for playlist adds (sharing playlists via Spotify, Youtube, Soundcloud, Apple Music, Google Play, Deezer, or Tidal) or social promotion via Instagram/Tumblr/Facebook/Twitter. Pay rate will depend on the size of your audience.

If you have a Bandcamp or Amazon account, we would like to work with you as well.

Please get in touch with any info on your social reach, Youtube channel, streaming audience, etc.

Applicants must be prompt, professional and willing to establish a positive working relationship. Reviews should be completed within 2 weeks of receiving the music. Anyone who takes longer than the specified time (without communicating with us) will be removed from our writer's list.

Writers will NOT post reviews on our website, but must have their own platform.

Please get in touch with any prior experience, current places you write for, etc and we'll get back to you asap. Thank you!
title: Music Bloggers, Playlisters & Social Influencers Wanted

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Music promotion/PR company working with both local and international artists looking for casual quality freelance writers to write music features/reviews or short blog posts for our independent artists. We are only looking for writers who already contribute to a quality, medium or high traffic publication or blog, or can pitch features. Genres vary and all are high quality. We are looking for writers who have a true passion for honest, underground music like we do. Reviews are paid $10-$60 EACH depending on blog/publication audience. This is contract work meaning you could be sent anywhere from 1 - 10 artists per month. 

Reviews also should be your own opinion. They do not need to be positive. This must be an honest process. 

We are ALSO looking for social influencers who are interested in considering our artists for playlist adds (sharing playlists via Spotify, Youtube, Soundcloud, Apple Music, Google Play, Deezer, or Tidal) or social promotion via Instagram/Tumblr/Facebook/Twitter. Pay rate will depend on the size of your audience.

If you have a Bandcamp or Amazon account, we would like to work with you as well.

Please get in touch with any info on your social reach, Youtube channel, streaming audience, etc.

Applicants must be prompt, professional and willing to establish a positive working relationship. Reviews should be completed within 2 weeks of receiving the music. Anyone who takes longer than the specified time (without communicating with us) will be removed from our writer's list.

Writers will NOT post reviews on our website, but must have their own platform.

Please get in touch with any prior experience, current places you write for, etc and we'll get back to you asap. Thank you!
title: Music Bloggers, Playlisters & Social Influencers Wanted

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
ABOUT RIP VAN:
We started Rip Van out of a college dorm room at Brown University. Our first product, Rip Van Wafels is available in 12,000 Starbucks locations nationwide and has become Silicon Valley's #1 snack.  The company has grown by +500% in the last three years, has made both the Inc & Forbes 30 under 30 lists and won numerous business awards. 

"Rip Van" is a metaphor for change and was inspired by the story of Rip Van Winkle who woke up to a changed world. 

We believe people deserve better. Better means change and our company exists to create that change by inventing better convenient products. Convenient products that are uniquely delicious, healthier and beautifully designed, because convenience is necessary in today's fast paced world.

The inspiration behind our first product, Rip Van Wafels, was to bring Americans a better indulgent snack, considering the unoriginal and unhealthy options out there. The idea was to create a different snack that has the indulgent taste of a candy bar with the sugar levels of a health bar.

We saw the Dutch "stroopwafel" as the perfect snack to re-invent. It is arguably one of the best tasting treats in the world but like most treats is loaded with sugar, made with poor ingredients and hasn't changed in the last 200 years. 

Since change is a continuous process, as a company we're committed to continuously improving our products and launching these improvements every 2 years. So far we've launched 3 Rip Van Wafel iterations, reducing sugar levels from 14 to 8-9 grams while improving our ingredient quality and perfecting our signature crispy and chewy texture with a preservative free 12 month shelf life.

------

ABOUT YOU:
You are looking to be part of something that is bigger than yourself. You have a type A personality, are a quick learner, extremely meticulous, thorough and organized. You are incredibly hungry to grow professionally, meaning that you're eager to put in 60-80+ hr work weeks to do what is needed for the business while rapidly developing your professional skill set in parallel, which will enable you to rise within our company. 
 
At Rip Van we're deeply passionate improving people's lives through the products we make. Since this requires us to work incredibly hard and challenge the status quo we've created a culture based on a set of values that embraces and encourages change and constant evolution. Our culture is unconventional and attracts a particular type of individual. One that has a beginner's mindset, takes ownership, embodies an egoless and meritocratic approach and strives for excellence. We know our culture isn't for everyone and considering company culture is the life force of an organization, if what you're reading doesn't resonate with you we'd appreciate it if you don't apply for this position.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
·Support and create leverage for co-CEO's in day-to-day sales activities to increase their value add.
·Facilitate, create presentations, agendas and attend all internal meetings such as weekly & monthly sales, All Hands, and quarterly board meetings
·Complete projects with (or on behalf of) the executive team 

 REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: 
·Bachelors Degree from a top 20 university
·Track record of perseverance & achievement - having overcome major obstacles through strong work ethic that has lead to stellar achievement in professional, academic and/or extra curricular activities
·Ability to manage highly sensitive issues under tight deadlines
·Strong desire to work extremely hard in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with high-energy and mission-driven colleagues
·Advanced knowledge and ability to leverage google apps, as well as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint 
·Flexible, adaptable and resourceful 
·Critical and strategic thinker with the ability to solve complex problems
·Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, as well as the ability to build relationships and negotiate
·Excellent data analysis, reporting and project management skills
·Ability to read between the lines and intuitively anticipate the needs and priorities of the business, and work independently and effectively with little oversight or management
title: Executive Sales Assistant

Cook for Day Care Center WANTED.  Please have: NYC Department of Health Qualifying Certificate in Food Production OR cooking experience and willingness to obtain Certificate in Food Protection

Job Purpose:
Serves meals for children in our Day Care Program ages 3 months - 12 years by reviewing recipes; assembling, combining, and cooking ingredients; maintaining equipment, inventory, and a sanitary kitchen.

Duties:
* Plans meals by following menu provided by program; keeps clear inventory

* Prepares ingredients by following simple menu; slicing, cutting, chopping, mincing, stirring, whipping, and mixing ingredients; adding seasonings; verifying taste.

* Completes meal preparation by grilling, sauteeing, roasting, frying, and broiling ingredients; verifying doneness and taste; assembling and refrigerating cold ingredients.

* Serves meals by classroom; distributes plates, dishes, bowls, and serving utensils to each classroom

* Maintains a sanitary kitchen by adhering to state and local sanitation, storage, and refrigeration requirements and codes; cleaning equipment.

* Maintains supplies inventory by checking stock; anticipating needs; reports needs to site director

* Keeps equipment operating by following operating instructions; troubleshooting breakdowns; performing preventive and cleaning maintenance; letting Site Director know if repair is needed

Skills/Qualifications: 
Verbal Communication, Pier Relationships, Energy Level, Dependability, Productivity, Attendance, Confidentiality, Flexibility

FULL TIME.  Benefits include:  sick pay, TransitChek, child care
title: Cook for Day Care Center

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We are looking to hire a server for our Sunday and Monday night shifts.

The ideal candidate would be super positive, friendly, hospitable, hard working and reliable. 

To be completely transparent Sundays and Mondays are our slowest nights, but can get very busy at times, so we need someone that can take 10-15 tables when necessary. 

We are a casual bar/lounge that wants to provide upscale casual service to our guests. We are very lucky to be an "industry bar"- a good portion of our guests come from other local bars/restaurants/hotels. 

Our kitchen is open until 3am every night. 

We offer a casual work environment, managers that are relaxed (no yellers), room for growth (do you want more shifts? Would you eventually like to learn to bartend or manage?) , shift meals (you can order from the menu).

Unfortunately this position doesn't have a lot of flexibility, we don't have coverage for your weekend shifts, so if you like to go away for the weekend- this position isn't for you. 


General Responsibilities

-	Comply with all our employee handbook requirements and policies
-	Show a teamwork spirit
-	Be responsible for the proper organization, set up and cleanliness of their work station and section at all time. Side work duties are assigned and must be completed in order to assume this responsibility
-	Adequate knowledge of basic restaurant service manners and our specifications
-	Greeting of all guest upon arrival and departure
-	Carrying out all public conversations in a professional and business like manner
-	Following up on guest satisfaction until the end of their stay 
-	Supervise table bussing at all time

World Renowned and James Beard Winning Pastry Chef Dominique Ansel is looking for FULL-TIME and PART-TIME Baristas/Waitstaff for his flagship SoHo location, Dominique Ansel Bakery!

We are looking for dedicated, passionate, hard-working individuals to be part of the team. Come grow with us! 

This position is perfect for someone who wants to get a foot through the door in the Food and Beverage industry. The work environment is fast-paced and customer-service oriented. Be prepared to work hard and learn about food, hospitality, and service.

Members of our team are expected to have POS and coffee knowledge as well as be comfortable with menu memorization and regular communication with the team on inventory, customer service, and special promotions.

Requirements:

• A genuine passion and knowledge for food and pastry
• Greets customers and takes food order
• Memorization of the menu, provides information about products to customers
• Prepares all drink orders and food packaging to Dominique Ansel Kitchen standards
• Operates a cash register, accurately counts and provides change to customers 
• Follows the bakery operational policies including safety and security procedures, during each shift
• Maintains a calm demeanor during periods of high volume, providing a positive example for the team
•Sociable and friendly to customers. We believe a positive attitude is your biggest asset!

Please check out our website here: www.dominiqueansel.com

Looking for Talented Individuals for an established Dumbo based Restaurant group.

We are looking to find like minded, hospitality driven, individuals that want to contribute their talent and passion to our growing team. Must haves for all candidates: Curiosity and a love of food, drink, people, and restaurants

We offer a competitive salary and benefits

We are an equal opportunity employer 

Duties and Responsibilities

•	Direct and administer all catering event operations to include, but not limited to, guest service, soliciting new accounts, negotiating contracts, merchandising and marketing, planning, event execution, cost control implementation, systems management, budget and forecasting, department management, adherence to federal, state and local standards and meeting participation and facilitation
•	Develop market segments, solicit new customers, negotiate contracts and maintain relationships with current customers
•	Monitor and develop team member performance to include, but not limited to, providing supervision and professional development, scheduling, conducting counselling and evaluations and delivering recognition and reward
•	Recruit, interview and train team members
•	Oversee event planning and management, including staffing, event timelines, site visits and walk-throughs, rentals and other vendor services
•	Oversee event logistics and facilities, including coordination of load-outs & load-ins, inventory, vehicle assignment and maintenance
•	Oversee culinary area and liaison with Executive Chef, including preparation of food, product inventory and ordering process, final expediting for events (food load-outs), and kitchen staff
•	Strategically delegate, and re-evaluate, the daily workload and assignments of staff to execute deliveries, setups, and full-service events, in a manner that appropriately minimizes labor cost while maximizing customer satisfaction
•	Assist with generating new event vendors and fostering good working relationships with existing event partners


Required Skills and Abilities

•	Previous experience as Events Director in a high-profile environment
•	Proven ability to manage events up to 1500 guest
•	Strong leadership, motivational and people skills
•	Demonstrated career experience in guest service management
•	Extensive food and wine knowledge
•	English fluency
•	Computer literacy and familiarity with restaurant management software
•	Acute financial management skills
•	Culinary school diploma or BS degree in Business Administration is a plus
•       Staff scheduling, Microsoft Office, Catering Service, Triple Seat

Please email your resume (as an attachment) for consideration. We are an equal opportunity employer.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Active Manhattan-based developer is looking for an Assistant Construction Superintendent to help with day-to-day field operations and supervision of our active job sites.
 
Duties and Responsibilities:

- Assist with on-site supervision of construction site
- Prepare daily reports, photo reports, job diaries and other reports as required.
- Act in a reasonable and responsible manner to maintain a safe job site and ensure compliance with DOB requirements
- Inspect all areas and floors where construction activity is occurring
- Correct unsafe conditions
- Maintain required logs and safety plans at each job site 
- Assure all safety paperwork is completed and organized
- Maintain thorough understanding of project documents
- Resolve DOB violations, as necessary
- Coordinate the completion of safety paperwork by subcontractors
- Shall be the designated person to respond to DOB, DOT, DEP, FDNY, and OSHA compliance visits and to establish strategies for citation contests

Desired Skills and Experience
- College degree not necessary
- Construction Superintendent license not necessary, but MUST have full knowledge of DOB requirements as pertains to construction sites (8 stories and under) with regards to logs, violations, safety, SWOs, etc...
- MUST have a valid 10 or 30 hour OSHA certificate
- MUST have at least 3 years experience in construction- experience should include some supervisory responsibility
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills 
- Ability to be highly organized, detail oriented and ability to prioritize multiple tasks at once through completion
- Understanding of all phases of construction operations

Please include a resume if you wish to be considered for the position.

Job-type: full time

Compensation: $62,500/year
title: Assistant Construction Superintendent for Manhattan-based Developer

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        





Greenwich St. Jewelers


Selling Sales Manager for Jewelry Boutique


Job Label: 3.19.18 - Sales Manager


Greenwich St. Jewelers is a rapidly expanding fine jewelry boutique located in downtown Manhattan. We present a curated assortment of sought-after and emerging designers, exquisite custom design work, and an extensive selection of engagement and wedding rings. Our smart, accomplished team is dedicated to best-in-class service that consistently delivers on our brand promise of wisdom, inspiration and discovery.

We are currently searching for a talented, experienced Sales Manager to join our team. To be successful in this role, you must be:


	A passionate trainer and motivator excited to develop a sales team and take responsibility for their success
	An empathetic, genuine leader focused on ensuring a positive, professional environment that promotes trust and cooperative teamwork 
	A creative thinker who can develop action, incentive and training plans to drive team and store performance  
	Able to model strong sales leadership and performance, playing an active role on the sales floor with a focus on client service and luxury experience
	Committed to thoroughness with the ability to document, analyze and report monthly store performance, merchandise trends and employee/store happenings to ownership
	Interested to develop and promote store events to drive sales
	Experienced with fine jewelry, including colored gemstones and loose diamonds; GIA certification or equivalent preferred


 

All potential candidates go through a rigorous interview process which includes phone and in-person interviews, personality and skill testing and background/reference checks. This process has allowed us to build a dedicated, collaborative and high performing team.

 

Compensation and Benefits include:

 


	
	Annual Salary ($100-$115k - commensurate with experience)
	
	
	Paid vacation and sick time off
	
	
	Medical, dental and vision insurance
	
	
	401K with employer contributions
	
	
	Generous employee discounts
	


 



Established in 1976, Greenwich St. Jewelers is one of NYC's most established and fastest growing retail jewelry companies. With a passion for designer jewelry, and specialties in custom design and restoration, we offer an unmatched experience and expertise in a friendly, professional environment.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

 



Ideal candidates will have:


	Entrepreneurial mindset who thrives on meeting sales goals; proven success in previous positions a must
	Prior experience in a similar position where selling and managing went hand-in-hand
	Natural leader and motivator to rally a team to work together to get the job done
	Direct experience with jewelry and GIA certification preferred
	Exceptional interpersonal skills with an enthusiastic and engaging personality
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills
	100% team mindset with company first mentality
	Agility with computers, email and social media 


 

 





        To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by HireMojo.

    
    Apply for this job
    https://app.hiremojo.com/jobs/New_York/New_York/Fine_Jewelry_Store_Manager/453032788/job.htm?sourceType=9
    
        Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the recruiting team for decisions on next steps.
    


Related Keywords: jewelry, fine jewelry, sales, retail, designer, diamonds, gemstones, custom design, GIA, business development, advisor, designer, luxury
title: Selling Sales Manager for Jewelry Boutique

Egg Restaurant, a busy breakfast & lunch restaurant in Brooklyn, is looking for a versatile, affable, and diligent person to help round out our front of house staff.

You'll be an integral part of service, working in multiple roles. Some days you'll host, controlling the flow of seating and working with the kitchen to keep everything running smoothly. Other days, you'll bartend, helping prepare drinks, as well as fill in throughout the day as the dining room needs it, bussing tables, running drinks, prepping beverage service. You'll learn the ropes of our busy operation and graduate to server as appropriate. 

Additionally, anyone with lengthy service experience could be considered for a floor manager role.

You'll be joining a deeply committed and motivated core crew. We're looking for people to join us who are committed to quality and who believe in the importance of doing simple things well, people who love working in restaurants and want their work to make a difference. Individuals with an interest in food sourcing and sustainability issues - a major plus. 
You must be able to work weekends.	

Please email a resume and cover letter in which you elaborate on your experience working in a restaurant. Or come by and drop off a resume and cover letter during business hours.

Position available immediately. 3-4 shifts per week

You must live in the NYC metro area.  Long Island and Westchester are *not* a fit.  New York City Metro Area ONLY, please. ALL of the Boroughs qualify as acceptable. So does New Jersey if the commute to Times Square is under 40 minutes. Your address on the Federal W-4 and I-9 must meet this requirement! (This is an employee NOT 1099/CONTRACT position.)

Your overall responsibility will be to support the smooth operation of the technical components for clients. You will be involved with selecting, purchasing, configuring, installing, and supporting computer network, hardware, and software. THIS IS A POSITION THAT REQUIRES TRAVEL TO LOCAL CLIENTS. Our clients are generally located within the 5 boroughs.
Applicant must have workplace experience supporting networks of 5-30 PCs and standard Microsoft applications. Because of the challenges of the position, applicant must be highly organized and detail oriented. While this is not a coding position, only technically-fluent candidates should apply. WE TEST ALL APPLICANTS.

THIS IS A PERMANENT POSITION.

🔴   You MUST be able to PERMANENTLY and legally work in the USA without sponsorship. 

Responsibilities:
* Configure servers and network hardware
* Monitor site stability and performance
* Prioritize tasks and work independently yet interact well within a project-oriented team environment
* Ability to solve problems quickly and automate processes
* Documentation of current and future configuration processes and policies
* Troubleshoot problems with hardware, software, network, and security administration

Requirements:
* Experience with remote servers and back-ups
* Significant experience with Microsoft desktop and server software
* Working knowledge of security, web servers
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills

These are the things that will *really* set you apart from other applicants:
1) Strong PC skills (Please let me emphasize Strong -- Almost everyone can build a PC but not everyone knows all inner workings of the PC)
2) Ability to Diagnose and Troubleshoot PC Problems (i.e. Viruses, Spyware, damaged Peripherals)
3) Familiar with Wireless networks (Including Print sharing, File sharing, and Internet sharing)
4) Modem & DSL Installs
5) Running cables through ceiling and along walls.
6) Troubleshooting common office electronics (i.e. Fax Machines, Printers, projectors, DVD Players, TV's, Stereos)
7) Wireless Troubleshooting
8) Strong server building and administration skills
9) Experienced with Microsoft SBS and Windows 7/10 operating Systems.
10) Data Recovery -- Data rescue
11) Familiar with basic firewall configurations (i.e. DMZ, port forwarding, DHCP, etc)
12) Strategic network deployment experience. (i.e. Routers, Hubs, Switches, Access Points)
13) Hotspot Setups & Advanced Hot Spot Troubleshooting
14) Break/Fix

Many of the jobs that are dispatched will be during standard business hours, however there is the occasional after-hours work. Our starting compensation is based on experience from $21 - $42/hour (if you have little/no client networking experience in the field, please do not expect peak starting rate). We offer reviews every 90 days! 

We DO NOT OUTSOURCE!

Also note: once you join us, you will NOT be able to do outside freelance networking admin work (freelance or otherwise). You CAN bring work in-house and receive most of the revenue from the project, but our engineers may NOT compete with the shop.   We enforce a FIRM non-compete agreement!

Getting our attention is easy:
Submit a resume with a city/state location in it. We get loads of resumes with just a phone number in them. We won't be able to figure out if you are in the NYC metro area with just a phone number.
title: IT Admin - FIELD TECH -     PART-TIME

We're looking for happy, creative, energetic, and ambitious people to join our fast-growing team. Every day in our kitchens, we see an opportunity for food to be smarter, healthier, and more transparent; and we're always working to nourish, excite, innovate, fill, and fulfill. Inès is a relatively new neighborhood offering to the Upper East Side - we strive to bring our customers a superior and welcoming experience by combining the best in ingredients and equipment with the charm and service of a serene Parisian café.

We are looking for someone to grow with us. For this role, prior experience as a barista is required, but we also onsite provide training for all staff. Our staff will be expected to be well versed with top-of-the-line coffee equipment, as well as with basic prep for our food menu, which will evolve with seasonal availability.
