body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Job Summary:
The Chef de Cuisine is responsible for planning, implementing, directing and maintaining Brooklyn Winery's wine bar and event food programs. The CDC must ensure that all goals are met (e.g., catering client events and wine bar related) while complying with state and federal health requirements. In addition, the CDC is responsible for the hiring, training and management of all back of house personnel, always trying to ensure optimal staff utilization and efficiencies. The CDC will have full responsibility for the ongoing performance of back of house operations and report directly to the Executive Chef and the Director of Operations.

Responsibilities:
-Create dynamic wine bar and catering menus while keeping food and labor costs in line with P&L targets
       -Develop seasonal and consistently updated wine bar menus and conduct tastings for approvals as needed
       -Develop cocktail and family style catering menus in cooperation with event and sales teams 
       -Maintain recipe files for all wine bar and catering dishes
       -Track and audit food and labor costs
-Manage hiring process, training, scheduling, termination, and all other day-to-day operations of back of house staff 
       -Manage all back of house staff, making sure they comply with management protocols
       -Provide culinary leadership to staff
       -Consistently execute and oversee production of menu
       -Oversee portion control and food presentation
       -Keep track of and manage average time from order to delivery during wine bar service
       -Oversee food purchases and inventory control
       -Expedite and manage back of house staff during preparation and events
       -Create all documentation of prep needed for each event and update "master prep sheets" as needed (working knowledge of 
        Excel is necessary)
-Ensure that food business operates as per upper management's vision and standards
-Responsible for maintaining back of house compliance with Department of Health standards
       -Conduct regular food safety walkthroughs
-Act as point of contact for third party vendors, including pest control and dishwashing/chemical companies
-Communicate regularly with Event Director / Event Manager on upcoming events
       -Meet with private event clients or sales managers during the sales phase if deemed necessary by Director of Operations
       -Schedule and conduct food tastings for private event clients in conjunction with Events Team
       -Review upcoming events to ensure menu and timeline are accurate
       -Coordinate menu changes as needed (allergies, dietary restrictions, etc.)
       -Ensure excellent and consistent customer experience for events
-Oversee all food related inventory including food, plates, equipment, smallwares, etc.
-Responsible for maintenance of all kitchen equipment including fire systems, refrigeration, and dishwashers. This includes ensuring regular inspections and cleanings and when necessary facilitating work from appropriate repair companies
-Inform wine bar managers of any menu changes (cheeses, specials, etc.)
-Responsible for the timely ordering of all menu items and paper/cleaning goods
title: Chef de Cuisine at Brooklyn Winery

We are seeking a talented and enthusiastic Bartender to join our team at Reynard at the Wythe Hotel.

Reynard offers a dynamic work environment and an opportunity join a group of creative and passionate individuals. We love great food and hospitality, and strive to make that evident in everything we do.  We're an Employee-First company that is committed to excellence while being a positive force in our community.

WHAT WE OFFER:
Competitive Hourly Wages
Health Benefits including Medical, Dental and Vision
Paid Vacation 
Employee Discounts both in house and at our extended restaurant family.
Access to monthly Learning and Development classes like Butchery, Bread Making or Wine Tasting. 
Opportunities for growth within our restaurant family


OUR IDEAL APPLICANT HAS:
-Strong work ethic, excellent communication and people skills.
-A knowledge of and passion for fine food and beverages. 
-The ability to work 4 shifts a week and open weekend availability. This position may be scheduled for Brunch, Lunch and Dinner Service shifts.
-Thrives in a fast paced and energetic environment.
-Solid knowledge of French wines, classic cocktails, craft beers and regional and seasonal farm to table cuisine
-At least 2 years bartending experience in a high volume restaurant in NYC.
-Interest in becoming a part of and embodying the creative, dynamic and unique culture of  Wythe Hotel. 

Reynard is part of Andrew Tarlow's restaurant family, which also includes Diner, Marlow and Son's Romans, She Wolf Bakery and Achilles Heel. We serve a thoughtful and creative menu showcasing our whole animal butchery program and produce from local farmers while focusing on wood-fired cooking.

Reynard is proud to be a gratuity-free establishment, which enables us to pay all our employees competitively, fairly and with more stability. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Climate change is the most urgent issue of our time. With climate deniers firmly in control of national policies, it will be up to the states to hold corporate polluters accountable. New York must lead the way.


NYPIRG is hiring college students, recent grads, and others to mobilize the public on this critical issue. Build your resume, make friends, earn $500-700 per week, and help build a movement to stop climate change and win a renewable energy future.

The New York Public Interest research Group (NYPIRG) is a nonpartisan, not-for-profit organization that advances important public interest issues through sophisticated grassroots organizing and advocacy, public education, and media exposure. Since 1976, NYPIRG has played a key role in fighting for more than 150 public interest laws and executive orders that protect the environment and public health, safeguard consumers, improve public transportation, and foster open, responsive government.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Since 1912, Citarella has been a part of New York. Our name is synonymous with freshness, quality, and value. In a city that offers overwhelming variety, we proudly offer the largest selection of fresh seafood & aged prime meats along with prepared foods and gourmet groceries. While growing, we have maintained our commitment to providing the best quality, value, and service.
Citarella's Commissary Kitchen in Hunts Point, Bronx is seeking DISHWASHERS to join our culinary team! The dishwasher will be responsible for properly cleaning and sanitizing all dishes, utensils, pots and pans.  Sanitizing and cleaning all equipment (mixer, table, sheeter, storage container, etc...).  Assists with cleaning other areas of the kitchen as requested.

Job Qualifications:
•	Ability to move and lift heavy objects
•	Knowledge of basic sanitary guidelines
•	Strong work ethic
•	Ability to communicate with co-workers and supervisors
•	Ability to perform physical requirements of position including standing for extended periods of time
•	Lifting loads of up to 80 lbs
•	Ability to work a flexible schedule including nights, weekends and holidays

Responsibilities and Duties:
•	Operate dish machines to company and manufacturer specifications
•	Measure detergent and sanitizer in the dish machine
•	Clean and sanitize floors, drainers, freezer and cooler
•	Report to work at the scheduled time, neatly groomed and in the correct uniform.
•	Maintain kitchen work areas, equipment, or utensils in clean and orderly condition.
•	Sweep and scrub floors.
•	Sort and remove trash, placing it in designated pickup areas.
•	Transfer supplies or equipment between storage and work areas, by hand or using hand trucks.
•	In addition, other duties maybe required as directed by your manager.

The Donor SOURCE, a division of Fertility SOURCE Companies, is looking for women to become egg donors.  Egg donation is a special gift for those couples that cannot become pregnant on their own.  An egg donor's contribution will greatly increase the chances of couples and individuals being able to achieve a pregnancy.  With your selfless act of egg donation, you are giving the hope of a child to our intended parents and we cannot thank you enough!

About Our Program

	Earn $8,000 as a first-time donor; more for repeat donations
	All expenses paid for local AND travel donations (travel is not a requirement)
	Continue to study or work while still creating income
	Complete support by experienced, caring Case Managers throughout the process

	Industry leading program with partner clinics nationwide


Our program has a few requirements, you should be:

	Female between the ages of 21 and 29
	Within normal weight range for your height
	Healthy, with a healthy family history
	Non-smoker/No drug use

	Entirely reliable - transportation cannot be an issue as you will be required to attend approximately 10 different appointments over the course of two weeks.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We Are: 
	MageMojo Magento hosting, a group of 35 talented devops guys and gals who all work remotely.  We built Mojo Stratus - the ultimate development platform and hosting for Magento.  Mojo Stratus is a cloud native containerized PaaS / SaaS on AWS.

	We believe passionate, talented people all working together smoothly yields awesome work.  Work that lets us build a solid infra and processes to prevent fires instead of spending time always putting out fires. We draw a lot of support from each other and try to focus on the "human side" of support. We are curious students of the internet age who are interested in continuing to enhance our own work, sharing what we've learned, and learning from those around us.  https://magemojo.com

	About Our Industry and Magento:

	Magento is now one of the most valuable open source companies in the world after Adobe recently purchased Magento, Inc. for $1.68B.  Magento already powered 1/3 of the world's online stores with the Enterprise and Community versions.  With Adobe behind Magento there will be a huge demand for certified and skilled people who know how to work with the software.  The market is already in demand and will only grow more after the acquisition.

	We Will:

	
		Provide on the job training for Magento
	
		Require you to pass Magento certifications
	
		Provide on the job training for our Mojo Stratus platform
	
		Provide on the job critical thinking skills and emotional intelligence
	
		Build you into a master of Magento and communication making you highly valuable and sought after


	You Will:

	
		Agree to work with us for a period of time in exchange for the training we will provide
	
		Work remote from your home office
	
		Promptly fulfill client requests and resolve issues by ticket and by phone
	
		Troubleshoot Magento configuration and performance problems
	
		Diagnose and resolve common errors with major services, including DNS, Nginx, MySQL, and others
	
		Expand your knowledge and share it with other team members
	
		Be present at the assigned work hours
	
		Work during non-traditional hours and on the weekends as required by the demands of the position


	You Have:

	
		At least 2 years of PHP programming experience
	
		Hands-on experience with Nginx and MySQL
	
		Customer service experience required
	
		Experience with web hosting or server environments preferred
	
		Consistent commitment to top-tier customer service
	
		Advanced active listening and critical thinking skills
	
		Patience and perseverance when handling complex issues
	
		Even temperament
	
		Proficient at verbal and written communication
	
		Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	
		Insatiable desire to learn


	How To Apply:

	You are the perfect candidate if you have a programming background but enjoy the technical side more.  You love reading, learning, and growing your skills.  You want to work for a company who is willing to make a substantial investment in your future in return for a short commitment to the company.

	Submit your resume and a few words about yourself, your achievements, what you love most in life, and what you want out of your career.  Tell us why we should invest in you.  Send to hiring+nyc@magemojo.com.

Purpose for the Position: To perform a combination of tasks which maintain the hotel premises in a clean and orderly manner, thereby contributing to a pleasant, positive experience. Essential Responsibilities:

Provides professional and courteous service at all times.
Cleans and maintains all public areas, storage areas and administrative areas.
Clean rooms on request.
Run supplies and service items to guestrooms as requested.
Dusts, vacuums and overall maintains all public areas, hallways, restaurants, bars, rest areas and other spaces assigned.
Polishes metalwork and furniture.
Collects soiled linens for laundering and received and stores linen supplies in appropriate locations.
Vacuums floors.
Cleans restrooms.
Removes trash
Office cleaning.
Refurnishes areas with supplies as required.
Removes and disposes of trash.
Clean outside areas including porte cochier and other arrival areas.
Attends monthly department meetings.
Completes projects as determined by executive housekeeper.

To do this kind of work, you must be able to:

Use hands to lift, carry or pull objects that may be heavy.
Understand simple instructions.
Read and execute banquet event orders.
Work outdoors in all kinds of weather.
Learn simple procedures and techniques.
Perform routine work or the same task over and over again.
Be available for work evenings, weekends and holidays.

Physical Demands: Lifting 50 lbs. maximum with frequent lifting and/or carrying of objects weighing up to 25 lbs. Requires climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, crawling, reaching, handling, seeing, feeling.Environmental Conditions: Inside: Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. No variety of implicit wishes of people is involved in this function.Things: Handling: Using body members, hand tools, and/or special devices to work, move, or carry objects or materials. body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
About Lewa Wildlife Conservancy
The Lewa Wildlife Conservancy (the Conservancy) in northern Kenya is an award-winning catalyst and model for community-centric conservation, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and is featured on the IUCN Green List of excellence in protected area management. The Conservancy is the heart of wildlife conservation, sustainable development and responsible tourism in northern Kenya and its successful working model has provided the framework on which many conservation organizations in the region are based. For more information, please visit www.lewa.org.

Overview
Reporting to the Executive Director - USA and located in New York (possibility to work remotely), the Director of Finance and Operations oversees the day-to-day operations of the organization including finance, human resources, IT, legal, and facilities. This position is also responsible for developing the systems and infrastructure to support the organization's expected substantial growth over the next five to ten years. Working with the management team, the Director of Finance and Operations will contribute to the development and implementation of organizational strategies, policies and practices. 

Specific responsibilities include:

Financial Leadership and Management
•	Utilize financial data to analyze and improve organizational efficiency. 
•	Oversee budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow for administration, programs, and proposed new sites.
•	Assist with the preparation and control of operational budgets.
•	Manage grant process and assist Executive Director in managing all granting partnerships. 
•	Maintain all records and databases for granting partners and donors.
•	Review and approve monthly and annual financial reporting materials and metrics.
•	Prepare financial and donor/fundraising reports for Executive Director and Board of Directors.
•	Coordinate all audit activities.

Operations Leadership and Management
•	Manage all operations with the goal of providing a foundation for growth and stability while maintaining flexibility to react to a dynamic environment.
•	Serve as a business partner to the Executive Director on the organization's financial, budgeting, and administrative processes including HR, payroll, and benefits functions, with an eye to continuously developing and improving systems.
•	Facilitate coordination and communication between support functions.
•	Review and revise policies and procedures, as needed, to increase efficiency.
•	Maintain accuracy of records and files.
•	Manage relationships and agreements with external vendors and partners.
•	Lead Lewa's technical staff to design and implement an IT plan for the future.
•	Manage the organization's virtual infrastructure, system maintenance 
•	Work closely with IT and Finance in Kenya and other International Lewa offices

Qualifications
The Director of Finance and Operations will have at least five to eight years of professional experience, including managing the finance and operations of a high-growth $5-10 million organization (preference given to nonprofit experience). S/he will have experience creating and driving the analytic framework for planning and managing organizational change in a highly entrepreneurial organization. Additional qualifications include:

•	Bachelor's degree (MA/MBA preferred) in Business, Management, or Finance.
•	Demonstrated resourcefulness in setting priorities, proposing new ways of creating efficiencies, and guiding investment in people and systems.
•	Proven experience in financial management and accounting, legal, audit, compliance, budget and resource development, ideally in the nonprofit sector.
•	Technologically savvy, with experience leading IT staff to develop and implement new processes and systems that increased efficiency in a fast-moving environment.
•	Experience managing and coordinating projects and day-to-day operations across departments.
•	Excellent people skills with experience collaborating in a multi-disciplinary, diverse, and dynamic team.
•	Experience working with a Board of Directors.
•	Personal qualities of integrity, credibility, and a commitment to Lewa's mission.
•	Experience with Salesforce or other CRM, Dropbox, Outlook, and QuickBooks.
•	Ability to travel domestically and internationally, 20% of the time.
•	Good sense of humor!

To Apply:
Please send a cover letter and resume.
title: Director of Finance and Operations

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Critically acclaimed O Ya restaurant seeking professional lead line cook. Run by James Beard Award winning Chef Tim Cushman, O Ya restaurant is a chance to learn sushi and Japanese cuisine while working in a professional American kitchen.

We strive to keep a culture of collaboration and respect for our entire staff.

The ideal applicant will have: 
-2-3 years of NYC experience, culinary school a plus! 
-Ability and willingness to learn and grow


- Extensive Japanese cuisine knowledge is not required, the right applicant will be trained to work with various Japanese ingrendients, techniques, and cooking styles including: tempura, sautee, garde manger, pastry, grill, etc.

-Fine dining experience is a plus. Learn to work with small plates and composed dishes.

-Learn to break down fish from sushi chefs and learn how to make/plate nigiri and sashimi. 

We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

About O Ya:

Started in 2007 by husband and wife team Chef Tim and Nancy Cushman, O Ya restaurant builds on the form and flavors of traditional sushi and izakaya, Chef Tim's food is also informed by his decades of experience opening a wide variety of restaurants, finding inspiration in the cuisines of South East Asia, New England, France and beyond. As the Cushman Concepts group has grown Tim and Nancy continue to place great emphasis on people, making sure to hire staff that is dedicated and service oriented. The original O Ya restaurant in Boston has garnered numerous awards and accolades. O Ya New York City opened in June 2015 to great acclaim and continues the tradition of warm, natural service with internationally recognized cuisine.

For more information about our concepts:
o ya www.o-ya.restaurant
Roof at Park South www.roofatparksouth.com
Hojoko Boston www.hojokoboston.com
title: O Ya NYC seeks lead line cook

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
OUR COMPANY:

Bien Cuit is a James Beard Award nominated Brooklyn-based bakery & cafe. Our focus is on the high quality of our hand-crafted bread and pastry created by Chef Zachary Golper with our executive chefs. We are committed to sourcing practices that support regenerative agriculture and we work closely with regional farmers and millers whenever possible.

We are looking for an experienced, organized and enthusiastic Store Managers to help us promote growth at our retail locations, lead our team in achieving our sales targets. and provide training and support to our staff, generating the excellent customer service Bien Cuit's customers have come to expect.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Store Managers are responsible for every aspect of the location including:

Recruiting, managing and developing store staff.
Energizing and inspiring employees to ensure morale remains high.
Delivering outstanding customer service and experiences.
Balancing company and employees needs to create weekly schedules, taking into account seasonality and holidays.
Working collaboratively with marketplace marketing to participate in terminal activities in order to achieve greater brand visibility.
Executing on all selling activities including: merchandising, promotions, self-certification, food safety and protocol execution.
Achieving in-store compliance and loss prevention measures/standards.
Achieving store sales goals and driving sales through targeted and measured activities.
Managing store P&L and net revenue at store level.
Maintaining proper maintenance on all equipment and store.
Connecting on an agreed regular basis with the allocation team for inventory management.
Working closely with Area Manager, Executive Chef, Director Of Operations, daily operations activities, packaging, and displays.
Completion of all daily, weekly, and monthly reports.
Weekly and Monthly inventory, ordering and restocking.
Working with Area Manager and Chefs to create ordering pars, maximizing sales, minimizing sales.
Handling cash; double counting drawers, making deposits, investigating drawer overs and underage.

COMPETENCIES:

Self-motivated and customer service-oriented
Energetic and welcoming personality, capable of fostering encouraging environment where team can grow
Ability to think quickly and problem-solve
Able to maintain the highest standards of cleanliness and organization behind the counter
Able to communicate effectively with management, peers and guests

EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS

A food handling permit must be obtained within the first 30 days of employment.
2-4 years supervisory/management experience in a retail sales environment or similar fast-paced, customer service environment preferred. Experience working within a food environment is a must.
Previous experience in a retail sales environment with increasing levels of responsibility and strong working knowledge of general retail practices and procedures.
Demonstrated ability to effectively lead/direct, coach and train others in a retail setting, and the ability to relate well using communication, interpersonal, diplomacy and related skills required.
Passionate about bread & food!
Completion of ongoing training and development as listed on the Bien Cuit's Learning Plan.
Flexibility in work schedule is required including the ability to work extended hours, weekends, and holidays as operational need may require

Job Type: Full-time

Wage: Based upon experience and qualifications

Job Type: Full-time
title: Bien Cuit seeks Store Manager

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Since 1912, Citarella has been a part of New York. Our name is synonymous with freshness, quality and value. In a city that offers overwhelming variety, we proudly offer the largest selection of fresh seafood & aged prime meats along with prepared foods and gourmet groceries. While growing, we have maintained our commitment to providing the best quality, value and service. 
Citarella's Commissary Kitchen in Hunts Point, Bronx is seeking BUTCHERS to join our team! This role will be responsible for cutting, trimming and scraping of meat and poultry products. The ideal candidate should have experience within a perishable, food or provisional items.

Job Qualifications: 
•	3 - 5 years' experience butcher experience in preparing, cutting, and maintaining meat products
•	Ability to start overnight or early morning hours (start times vary by department)
•	Ability to use knives and other tools of the trade
•	Ability to recognize various cuts, sizes and species of Meat
•	Ability to read production labels and produce various cuts of meat for retail stores
•	Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus
•	Ability to stand for long period of times

Responsibilities & Duties:
•	Maintain and stock product in warehouse, understanding product dating and inventory control.
•	Cut, tris, bone, tie, and grind meats, using butcher's cutlery and powered equipment, such as electric grinder and band saw.
•	Use knives, cleavers, meat saws, band saws, or other equipment to perform meat cutting and trimming.
•	Prepare and trim all meat cuts, using knives, meat saw, cleaver, and bandsaw, to make roasts, steaks, chops, stew cubes, and grinding meat.
•	Tends electric grinder to grind meat. 
•	Shape and tie roasts. 
•	Maintain clean and organized work station, storage and surrounding areas. 
•	Follow all guidelines and procedures to maintain a safe and sanitary work environment.
•	Inspect meat products for defects, bruises or blemishes and remove them along with any excess fat.
•	Process primal parts into cuts that are ready for retail use.
•	Weigh meats and tag containers for weight and contents. 
•	Report to work at the scheduled time, neatly groomed and in the correct uniform.
•	In addition, other duties maybe required as directed by your manager.


This position is based out of our commissary kitchen located in Hunts Point, Bronx. Candidates are invited to reply to this ad with subject line "BUTCHERS" or stop by any of our Citarella store locations and complete an employment application. Please feel free to visit our website for further company information at: www.citarella.com.

IN RETURN, WE OFFER!
Competitive Wages, Medical/Dental /life insurance benefits, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Discounts, Paid Time Off, 401k Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match!
Citarella is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)

A wholesale food service company located in Long Island City, Queens, New York is currently seeking professional drivers with experience in driving Non-CDL box trucks and vans from 12-22 feet.

The driver's primary responsibility will be making customer deliveries and pick-ups along an assigned route.  The driver will also be responsible for loading and unloading their vehicle, such as light weight items and/or pallets.

In addition, the driver is expected to be familiar with NYC and the Tri-State area, and present a professional image of themselves and the company.

Full Time and Part Time positions are available.

Qualifications:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Clean driving record
* Able to work as part of a team
title: Driver-Experienced Non-CDL Drivers Wanted

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Merriweather Coffee + Kitchen, an independent Australian-owned specialty coffee shop in the West Village, is looking for an experienced barista to join the team.

About us: Our mission is to provide each of our guests with a sensational five-minute break in their crazy New York day.  We have created a bright, modern and welcoming space, inspired by the trendy beach cafes of Sydney and the craftsman culture of Brooklyn.  We offer the one of the highest quality coffee and food programs in the city modeled on the quintessential laid-back and unpretentious Australian café experience.  We were named in Zagat's Top 10 Hottest Cafes in New York City in April.

Our coffee program is off-the-hook  We are partnered with Counter Culture as our main roaster and also feature guest roasters such as Tandem from Maine and Sweatleaf from Brooklyn. We have invested in cutting-edge tools to make sure our guests get the best coffee possible, every time. For the coffee nerds out there, we were the first café in NYC to have the latest La Marzocco Linea PB with Auto-Brew-Ratio scales in the drip tray (say what!), and Mahlkonig Peak grinders!  We also have a pour-over program, batch-brew and cold-brew using our EK-43.

Not a coffee nerd but love people and hospitality? Great, we want you too (but you've got to love coffee).  Our amazing in-house coffee training is also complemented by our partnership with Counter Culture and their Counter Intelligence coffee training program offered to all our baristas.

Barista Position: We are recruiting a professional and dedicated personality who wishes to progress their skills and knowledge whilst bringing their own passion and enthusiasm for coffee and hospitality to a quickly growing new cafe.

You should also be able to:

- Prove your experience in a similar environment

- Be very fast, efficient, clean and work very well under continuous pressure

- Enjoy chatting with our hundreds of regulars who treat our staff like family

A very competitive rate of pay is on offer (a Food Handler's Certificate gets you bonus points, too), as well as working with a determined, passionate, enthusiastic and professional team with excellent working conditions on the best equipment in the city. Also we offer shift meals and all the coffee you can drink. You are the center of our business, and we will treat you accordingly.  You will be empowered to make your own decisions that create the best overall experience for our guests.
title: Experienced Barista - Merriweather

QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Responsibilities:
Administrative support and point of contact for Senior Vice President of National Recruiting firm.
Manage internal and external relationships fostering communication facilitating productivity goals for SVP.
Manage on-boarding paperwork including background screens and I-9 information.
Generate correspondence of user-friendly forms and documents using Excel and Word as well as manage Recruiting Database entries.
Heavy phone contact with candidates and calendar scheduling.
Strong writing skills with ability to manage related social media communications/content in highly confidential environment.

Required:
This position requires skills testing for MS Word, Typing (45 wpm), Proofreading, Grammar/Vocabulary
Some college credits 
2 year Administrative experience in a Recruiting or Sales department supporting a Senior Sales Executive.
Trending and research skills covering a variety of disciplines that support Recruiting and Relationship Management initiatives.
Understanding of the Full Cycle recruiting process and ability to work in a swift turnaround culture with low margin for error.
Understanding of unique Sales-Book of Business responsibilities where Monthly production numbers need to met.

From the James Beard Award-winning team behind Maison Premiere & Sauvage, the Golden Hour now seeks qualified Servers!  

Located in The Highline Hotel, the Golden Hour has an unobstructed views of the burgeoning Chelsea skyline from its sidewalk café. The garden is a hushed exit from the traffic of the street, a lush outdoor dining room of brass tables and tropical vegetation.

We are a growing team with many exciting projects in the works. This is a great opportunity for hospitality professionals to develop their career together with us.

Please contact us with the specific position you are interested to apply for in the subject of your email. Please paste your resume in the body of the email and write a couple of sentences about yourself and your previous experiences. 

We are looking forward to meet you!
Thank you for your interest in joining our team.

Since 1912, Citarella has been a part of New York. Our name is synonymous with freshness, quality and value. In a city that offers overwhelming variety, we proudly offer the largest selection of fresh seafood & aged prime meats along with prepared foods and gourmet groceries. While growing, we have maintained our commitment to providing the best quality, value and service. 
Citarella, The Ultimate Gourmet Market, is seeking CAKE DECORATOR with well-versed experience in cake decorating and icing, assisting in batter preparation, and various high -volume baking tasks. Our Cake Decorators will integrate into the pastry team to help facilitate daily preparation and production of large and small volume pastry items while ensuring the highest level of quality in our product.

Job Qualifications: 
•	Minimum of 3 years' relevant baking experience in high volume, fast paced kitchen, or comparable environment.
•	Professional work ethic and effective communication skills
•	Ability to take direction and follow recipes
•	Proficiency in all aspects of Pastry and Baking including but not limited to cakes, pies, chocolates, confections, and individual and production pastries
•	Ability to work independently, resourcefully, and meet hard deadlines
•	Ability to meet physical demands including extended periods of standing and walking throughout the day; able to lift and carry 25-50 pounds, push/ pull up to 50 pounds
•	Must be able to work holidays and weekends

This position is based out of our production kitchen located in Hunts Point, Bronx. Candidates are invited to reply to this ad with subject line "Cake Decorator" or stop by any of our Citarella store locations and complete an employment application. Please feel free to visit our website for further company information at: www.citarella.com.

IN RETURN, WE OFFER!
Competitive Wages, Medical/Dental /life insurance benefits, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Discounts, Paid Time Off, 401k Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match!
Citarella is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)
title: Cake Decorator

OPEN CALL TUESDAY 5/29, WEDNESDAY 5/30, AND THURSDAY 5/31 2-4pm 

Tapuz event staffing is hiring vibrant and energetic individuals to work with us at events throughout the New York City metropolitan area.. Currently recruiting FOH Servers, Bartenders, Captains, Cooks and Porters to work various events. MUST BE AVAILABLE THIS SATURDAY JUNE 2ND. This is the ideal position for entrepreneurs, working actors, models or servers and bartenders that want to pick up sporadic gigs where there is a guaranteed amount of money to be made for a specific shift, as opposed to relying on tips. Events are scheduled in advance allowing our team members to continue with their current projects. Please respond with resume if you are interested in the opportunity to be part of our strong team for the upcoming busy season.

*****SERVER REQUIREMENTS*****

Clean and polished appearance.
Ideal candidate has held similar positions in catering for at least 1 year and restaurant experience is a PLUS
Must be friendly, OUTGOING and be a high energy individual.
Must be able to walk and stand comfortably for long periods of time.
Ability to work independently, and as a motivated team player.
Responsibilities may include but not limited to:

Reviewing information and/or materials for the event with the onsite contact.
Set up and break down of the work area in different settings - i.e. Buffet, Seating, etc. * Ensuring guests are getting a good experience aligned with the event, client and host's expectations.
Must be able to interact in a friendly and enthusiastic way with high end clientele, large catering companies and all the various staff involved in the production.
Greet and/or assist guests, attendees, or event participants. Specialized duties vary based on client's needs- i.e. coat check, busing, service for a seated dinner, sanit etc.
Work a beer and wine bar only is a PLUS.
*****BARTENDER REQUIREMENTS*****

Clean and polished appearance.
Will only be interviewing bartenders with full mixed drink/full bar set up experience (UNEXPERIENCED BARTENDERS SHOULD KNOW THEY ARE NOT THE BARTENDERS FOR US)
Must be able to interact in a friendly, enthusiastic, energetic and outgoing manner with clients and consumers in any setting including switching to a server position if needed.
Server experience is PLUS.
Must be well spoken.
Self motivated. Proactive.
Must be able to walk and stand comfortably for long periods of time
Responsibilities may include but not limited to:

Ensuring guests are getting a good experience aligned with the event, client and host's expectations.
Responsible for reviewing drink programs, set up and break down of the work area and the preparation of products.
Must be able to interact in a friendly, enthusiastic, energetic with very high end clientele.
Candidates must be comfortable assisting with other duties at catered events - i.e. serving, busing, bar back etc.
****CAPTAIN REQUIREMENTS: ****

Leading catering for high end catered events.
Must have substantial experience with off-premise events.
Should have worked events ranging from corporate to social in different service styles.
Must have at least 2- 3 year of experience in the listed position. Management experience in other areas in hospitality is a PLUS.
Clean, polished and professional appearance.
Must be well spoken, self motivated, comfortable interacting with very high end clientele.
Must be able to interact in a friendly, enthusiastic, energetic and outgoing manner with staff, clients and guests in any setting.
Must be able to walk and stand comfortably for long periods of time.
Ability to work independently, and as a motivated team player.
Responsibilities may include but not limited to:

Engaging and educating staff on the client's expectations for the day.
Responsible for reviewing BEO, delegating duties like set up and break down of the work area, and the preparation and execution of the plan in place.
Ensuring all aspects of event are running smooth.

From the James Beard Award-winning team behind Maison Premiere & Sauvage, the Golden Hour now seeks a qualified candidate for a full time Floor Manager. 

Located in The Highline Hotel, the Golden Hour is on 10th Ave (20th & 21st), with unobstructed views of the burgeoning Chelsea skyline from its sidewalk café. The garden is a hushed exit from the traffic of the street, a lush outdoor dining room of brass tables and tropical vegetation.

We are looking for a manager who fully embraces hospitality, who implements new ways to exceed guests' expectations, and who genuinely enjoys doing so. An impeccable attention to details and an interest in seafood, oysters, wine, and craft cocktails is important.

The position requires strong training skills, superior organization, a proven ability to set and accomplish goals, and a never-ending drive to motivate our staff and perfect our service. A combination of daytime Brunch and Dinner shifts is required. Additionally, this position will handle inventory and administrative tasks associated with training and product knowledge.

We are a growing team with many exciting projects in the works. This is a great opportunity for hospitality professionals to develop their career together with us.
title: The Golden Hour (@ The High Line Hotel) is hiring a Floor Manager

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
If you are an experienced and impressive CFO with the business chops to market your services and help grow our client base - we want you! 

The CFO position will afford you a high degree of flexibility, the ability to focus on CFO-level work (while your Senior Accountant handles all of the transactional accounting), an opportunity to work with exciting companies, and a support network of financial professionals. 

We are looking for stellar CFOs who want to support an interesting mix of clients while building and managing their client relationships. If you are ready to work with cutting-edge startup companies, while strongly representing the EGFS brand - this opportunity is for you! 

Please note that regular on-site meetings are required, so qualified candidates must live in close proximity to New York City. 


Responsibilities - 

Manage finance and accounting functions
Provide business analysis on companies operations and product results
Direct all accounting functions, including payroll, account receivables/collections, expense processing, taxes, and revenue recognition and reporting (working with a Senior Accountant, as necessary)
Provide leadership needed to plan and grow profit efficiently, including developing budgets and providing accurate projections in support of business strategy.
Present timely and valid interpretation of operating results
Responsible for overall fiscal operations: directing internal financial programs and procedures. and maintaining useful relationships with outside partners and vendors
Provide ongoing financial analysis and modeling to a range of company leaders in support of key business decisions
Provide sound leadership in complying with financial and legal requirements
Develop short-range and long-range financial plans to achieve established corporate goals
Qualifications -

12+ years in a financial role with at least 5+ years as a finance leader
Experience working with venture-backed technology companies
Strong understanding of equity and debt financing
Proven track record in successfully supporting growth using strong analytical skills and effective financial modeling and tracking
Experience leading financial budgeting and financial planning process
Ability to oversee and review corporate accounting functions
Solid understanding of financial compliance requirements and experience implementing and managing financial policies
High level of energy and ability to thrive in fast-paced, dynamic business environments 
Successful at executing on business development, networking, and sales activities to build client base

No phone calls please: To apply please visit our website or use this direct web application: https://earlygrowthfinancialservices.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25

CFO
Early Growth Financial Services (EGFS) is an outsourced financial services firm that provides early-stage companies with three platforms of financial support: transactional accounting, CFO / strategic finance, and compliance. With our team of outsourced CFOs, Controllers, Senior Accountants, and Bookkeepers, we provide small to mid-sized companies with the support they need so that they can reduce their cost structure and focus on their core business. The majority of our clients are venture-backed technology companies but we work with companies across a wide variety of sectors and verticals.

If you are an experienced and impressive CFO -- with the business chops to market your services and grow our client base -- we want you!. The CFO position will afford you a high degree of flexibility, the ability to focus on CFO-level work (while your Senior Accountant handles all of the transactional accounting), an opportunity to work with exciting companies, and a support network of financial professionals. 

We are looking for stellar CFOs who want to support an interesting mix of clients while building and managing their client relationships. If you are ready to work with cutting-edge startup companies, while strongly representing the EGFS brand, this opportunity is for you. 

Please note that regular on-site client meetings are required, so qualified candidates must live in close proximity to New York City.

Please, no phone calls. To apply - include your professional resume in PDF or Word format (no LinkedIn data downloads), and include the position and the city you're applying for in the subject of your email. 

Responsibilities:
 
Manage finance and accounting function.
Provide business analysis on companies operations and product results.
Direct all accounting functions including payroll, account receivables/collections, expense processing, taxes, and revenue recognition and reporting (working with Senior Accountants, as necessary).
Provide leadership needed to plan and grow profit efficiently, including developing budgets and providing accurate projections in support of business strategy.
Present timely and valid interpretation of operating results.
Responsible for overall fiscal operations: directing internal financial programs and procedures, and maintaining useful relationships with outside partners and vendors.
Provide ongoing financial analysis and modeling to a range of company leaders in support of key business decisions.
Provide sound leadership in complying with financial and legal requirements.
Develop short-range and long-range financial plans to achieve established corporate goals.

Qualifications

12+ years in a financial role with 5+ years as a finance leader
Experience working with venture-backed technology companies
Strong understanding of equity and debt financing
Proven track record in successfully supporting growth using strong analytical skills and effective financial modeling and tracking
Experience leading financial budgeting and financial planning process
Ability to oversee and review corporate accounting function
Strong organizational and project management skills
Solid understanding of financial compliance requirements and experience implementing and managing financial policies
High level of energy and ability to thrive in fast-paced, dynamic business environments
Successful at executing on business development, networking, and sales activities to build client base

Early Growth Financial Services (EGFS) is an outsourced financial services firm that provides accounting, CFO, strategic finance, tax, and valuation services and support to small to mid-sized companies at every stage of the development process. EGFS currently supports 10-15% of all venture-backed companies in the US. With on-the-ground operations in 9 markets -- from Silicon Valley to Chicago to NYC -- EGFS supports the finance function for 500+ clients including TechShop, Indiegogo, OUYA, ZenDesk, Klout, RocketSpace, Open ERP, and more! EGFS earned the #13 spot in Silicon Valley Business Journal's 2014 Fast Private Award, the #797 spot on the Inc. 5000 for 2014, and the #3 spot in the Inc. 5000 for fastest growing company in San Jose. We are growing and looking for talented, driven people to grow with us!
EGFS was ranked #5 in Silicon Valley Business Journal's Fastest Growing Private Company Award for 2013. We are proud of this achievement and see it as proof positive that we provide an invaluable service to small businesses.  For a sampling of our clients and more information, please visit our website at earlygrowthfinancialservices.com


No phone calls please:  To apply please visit our website or use this direct web application: https://earlygrowthfinancialservices.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=25

Metropolitan Property Group is a team of over 180 agents working with clients to rent, sell and buy the city's best apartments, co-ops and condos. We are one of the most aggressive brokerage houses in the city and are breaking company records. 

Currently, we are expanding and looking for new talent. We are willing to train the right person, so prior experience is not required. 

Still in school? You can begin to train as you finish your coursework.

In this economically uncertain time, those looking to make the switch from their present career are beginning to wonder if it is worth the risk. Metropolitan's answer: It is! 

A big misconception right now is that the real estate market is floundering. While this does prove true in the home buying market, the rental market, especially in New York City, has seen little change. 

We work in the greatest city on Earth and everyone wants to be a part of it. 

From college students and couples to entertainers and families, anyone can call New York City home. 

Our job is to make sure they find them the best possible space for their money. 

Metropolitan Property Group brokers residential and commercial deals throughout the city. 

Although we have done deals in other boroughs, our agents work predominantly in Manhattan. 

Our commercial sector specializes in retail, office and industrial properties within Manhattan.

At this point in time we are looking for all kinds of agents. 

Being a real estate agent requires great people skills, patience, determination, commitment and optimism. 

We are looking for genial, outgoing people who love the city and have a passion for helping people. You will meet all people from all walks of life so the ability to get along with just about everyone is important as well. 

Great Income!
Personalized Training!
NO DESK FEES EVER!
No Experience Necessary!
Excellent Splits!
24/7 Database Access!
99% of ALL THE LISTINGS IN MANHATTAN!
Free Training!
Email us today to schedule an interview with Sami Katri  Metropolitan Property Group  CEO or feel free to call Sami at  917 743 1713

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We're a reputable, fast paced, public accounting firm in Brooklyn that provides accounting and tax services to businesses and individuals. We're looking for an experienced tax CPA to join our team. The Senior Tax Manager will report directly to the Partner and will handle a book of clients with potential to earn commission on billings.

Responsibilities Include:
•	Ability to maintain strong client relationships
•	Strong communication skills, verbal and written
•	Understanding of the tax process and tax system management
•	Respond to client and firm associate requests in a timely, accurate, positive and professional manner
•	Prepare client correspondence, letters, e-mail, or other communications
•	Prepare individual, business, and fiduciary tax returns and projections in accordance with firm and professional standards
•	Prepare business accounting, financial statements, and review of same in accordance with firm and professional standards
•	Research tax and accounting issues
•	Provide technical assistance to clients
•	Tax compliance for all entity types, large complex returns
•	Management of multiple client projects
•	Assistance and development of less experience staff
•	Delegate projects to staff who can handle them most efficiently
•	Review all but the most complex personal and business tax returns
•	Gain expertise in all tax software programs
•	Develop expertise within agreed upon industry group(s)
•	Write articles for the various firm newsletters
•	Make presentations on topics within specialty areas, as requested
•	Develop client relationships through business and social meetings with personnel
•	Assist in developing staff through supervision, evaluation, and assistance in assigned projects
•	Perform formal training sessions for staff
•	Meet with prospective clients and cultivates prospects through referral sources
•	Assist with tax administration projects assigned by managers and partners

Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree in accounting, advanced degree preferred
CPA certification required
Minimum recent 10 years tax position in public accounting
Candidate must poses advanced computer skills
Knowledge of accounting and tax software such as proseries, lacerate, quickbooks, xero, etc. preferred
title: Senior Tax Accountant / Tax Manager

Since 1912, Citarella has been a part of New York. Our name is synonymous with freshness, quality, and value. In a city that offers overwhelming variety, we proudly offer the largest selection of fresh seafood & aged prime meats along with prepared foods and gourmet groceries. While growing, we have maintained our commitment to providing the best quality, value, and service.

Citarella, The Ultimate Gourmet Market, is seeking CDL DRIVERS (Class A or B) to join our growing family! We are seeking individuals whose interest and passion for driving and food are as unparalleled as our commitment to superb customer service and quality food.

Job Qualifications:

Minimum 2-3 years' experience driving straight trucks
Must have open availability work including nights, early mornings, holidays, weekends
Professional driving experience in NYC (Manhattan), Long Island and Connecticut (Preferred but not required)
Clean driving record is a must!
Must be organized, reliable, and demonstrate timeliness
Effective interpersonal and communication skills at all levels
Prior experience in a food/ retail company is a plus.
Must be able to meet physical demands of the position
Some of the responsibilities associated with this job include but are not limited to:
Transport store product to multiple store locations
Assist in loading and unloading of merchandise.
Understand and adhere to all traffic laws and regulations in respect to driving policies.
Communicate with dispatcher and store managers to ensure accuracy and timeliness of deliveries
Ensure refrigeration and proper temperatures are maintained in the trucks
This position is based out of our production kitchen located in Hunts Point, Bronx. Candidates are invited to reply to this ad with subject line "CDL Driver" or stop by any of our Citarella store locations and complete an employment application. Please feel free to visit our website for further company information at www.citarella.com .

IN RETURN, WE OFFER!Competitive Wages, Medical/Dental/Vision /life insurance benefits, Flexible Spending Accounts, Employee Discounts, Paid Time Off, 401k Retirement Savings Plan with Company Match!

Citarella is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)
title: CDL Truck Driver

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Looking for motivated, driven hard-workers who want to make MONEY! Get in contact with me, we will set up a quick interview and I WILL PAY for your Real Estate Classes! This is Scope Realty

As you get ready to begin or continue your real estate career, you must have thoughts as to what you are going to do with your future. You may be here for various reasons: 

1. You are looking for an opportunity that can change your life and you know Real Estate can give you that chance you have been looking for. 

2. You are looking for a career change. You simply were not making enough money to accomplish all of your life goals. You have only had enough to pay bills and you are sick and tired of that lifestyle. 

3. You have worked many jobs and had different careers and are looking to settle down. You want to invest your time with a company that will finally give you the opportunity to work and get paid what you feel you are worth. 

4. You have roots in the Real Estate Industry (Homeowner, Developer, Family in the business, etc.) and want to continue your growth and development in the business. You want to master the art of selling and learn about Sales, Commercial Real Estate & Rentals. 

5. You have a Real Estate License BUT it expired and you are here to reactivate it. You may feel like Real Estate let you down in the past yet you are ready to give the business another chance. You may have realized that you have never given it your all consciously or subconsciously and NOW you are ready to give it your best. 

6. You already have a career and are looking to dabble into Real Estate because you know you can create an extra income. You need to supplement your income because it's just not enough. 

7. You have always been interested in doing Real Estate but never had the time to get involved in it or you were involved in something else. Now, you have the time and you are finally ready to give Real Estate your best shot

Let's get to it.  Talk soon.
title: FREE Real Estate LICENSE

QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Melt bakery, New York's first Ice cream sandwich shop is looking for members to join the Melt family!

We are an ice cream sandwich shop with two storefront locations, many carts around manhattan, as well as multiple wholesale accounts across Manhattan and Brooklyn.

We are looking to bring in a hard working, fast, and reliable baker to join our team for another fun year of ice cream sandwiches!

Hiring for a baker position in the kitchen with an early morning start time.

Requirements: 
Eligible to work in U.S.
At least 18 years old
little to some experience working as a baker
Must be able to move, lift, carry up to 50 pounds
Food Protection Certificate (If you do not have one we will help you get one.)

Some of the responsibilities involved will include:

Scooping cookie dough
Baking 
Making dough
Sweeping / mopping
Scrubbing surfaces
Stewarding

If you think you are the perfect fit then please reply with a resume and leave your favorite flavor of ice cream in the subject line.
title: Baker position for the right candidate

Black Forest Brooklyn is looking for bartenders and baristas with full availability.

We are a beer hall with 16 beers on tap, local Brooklyn spirits, and authentic German comfort food. We have recently opened a second location on Smith St and are growing our team in preparation of a busy spring and summer. Our website is Blackforestbrooklyn.com

Please write a few sentences about yourself and why you think you would be a great fit for Black Forest Brooklyn. Please also put your resume in the body of your email. If you have schedule conflicts please put them in your email. Must be legal to work in the US.


While we take the time to review all applications, only those suitable for interview will be contacted.

Growing Pest Control Company seeking hard-working, motivated, and responsible individual to fill the position of pest control technician/exterminator to work in each of the 5 New York City boroughs. 

The ideal candidate will have at least 1-year experience in pest control, MUST be licensed (7A, 7F), have a reliable car and valid driver's license. MUST be able to work full-time with some flexibility of working nights and two Saturdays a month. Qualified candidates should have excellent verbal and written skills, able to work independently, as well as, part of the team. On-the-job training provided to motivated individuals with excellent customer service skills. Qualified candidates must also be able to pass a criminal background check and provide valid job references. 

We pride our business on the service given to customers, so presenting a professional appearance and attitude is imperative to our success. Salary structure is based on experience and credentials. 

Interested candidates should forward their resume via email. 

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer company.

Be sure to visit us at www.PharmorePC.com!

Why You Will Love This Job!

Are you compassionate, a great listener, and looking for a way to make a real difference in the world? Would you enjoy having a position where your people skills would be appreciated and put to good use? Does the opportunity for advancement, bonuses and rewards sound appealing? If so, you are the right fit for our part-time, entry level Behavior Technician role! 
 
As a Behavior Technician with our company, you would help others succeed in life as you work one-on-one with people of all ages who have autism and related disorders. Not interested in being stuck in an office? Your work would take you out into various community settings, such as homes and schools. 

With no experience necessary, this is the perfect opportunity to get your foot in the door with a company that will fully train you for success. Apply today! 
 
Responsibilities
Work closely with individuals affected with autism spectrum disorder 
Participate in required training programs  
Drive to a variety of locations 
Effectively use social and communication skills  

Qualifications
Eager, energetic and passionate demeanor 
High School Diploma or Equivalent 
Your own vehicle with proof of auto insurance or another reliable means of transportation 
Must pass TB test and criminal background check 
Availability to work three weekday afternoon or evening shifts (2 to 8 p.m.) and one weekend day shift (9 a.m. to 5 p.m.)

Do you want to make $100,000+ in sales, and work at a cool tech company?
... and I'm not talking about the BS jobs that pay only commission. Those are a joke.
I mean, if those companies are making so much money, why can't they afford to pay a decent base salary AND commissions?
Well, it's because no one working for only commission is getting "rich". They are barely paying bills, if that.
All the top sales pros work at exciting and growing companies that can afford to pay them a high salary because the product they are selling has a strong demand. (and OMG it's so much easier to sell too!)
And these growing companies... many of them are in the software industry.
Did you know the average car salesperson only makes $30,000 a year, according to Glassdoor?
While a software sales rep brings in $100,800 annually?
Completely different! It's like they are two vastly different jobs... but they are both still sales roles!
But I mean... if you choose to work in sales, you're choosing to do so because you want to make great money, enjoy the freedom and perks of your job, and have a sense of purpose in communicating with, and winning/helping customers.
(... ah yes, the perks ... like an office that has a keg on tap, a ping-pong room, or XBOX to use for break. Or maybe you just want the ability to work remote because you're good at what you do, regardless of where you do it?)
So why not do it in an industry that pays more? I mean, it takes same amount of time and effort to sell right?
And the crazy thing is, right now... many of our software company partners are telling us they can't find qualified people to hire for their entry level sales roles starting in 2018!
And this leads to exactly why many brand-new AND experienced salespeople are signing up for the preHIRED program.
If you are tired of not making enough money in sales, or tired of working at company you don't like -- then this may be just for you... so check this out.
preHIRED is an online Science-Based Sales℠ training & job placement program to take you From Zero to Your Six-Figure Software Sales Job in 40-hours.
We train you on the SOFTWARE industry, and how to get your foot in the door.We train you on all the TOOLS and APPS you'll be using in a software sales role.We train you on SCIENCE-BASED SALES℠ and marketing processes, playbooks, and tactics.
(ALL IN JUST 40 hours!)
Then we get YOU HIRED at one of our partner companies.
... or we show you how to get a software sales job at companies you pick.
AGAIN... WE GET YOU HIRED -- ALL WITHIN 60 DAYS!

Seriously, this is for real. My name is Joshua K Jordan and I've been working and training with software sales teams around the country for the last two years. (check me out at https://www.linkedin.com/in/joshkjordan/)
If you want to submit an application for our program to see if it's a fit for you, just check out the link below.
https://www.sciencebasedsales.io/six-figure-sales-career-cl/
Each program has limited space to ensure everyone gets hired quickly.  Apply today!
( ...or else you may find yourself on the waitlist)
Hope to connect soon,
-- Josh
title: 🚀  Software Sales Bootcamp - $50k BASE SALARY + $50k Comm 🚀

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
*** Please note that this job asks for live-in M-F and live-out on weekends at your own residence. ***

MUST HAVE PREVIOUS LIVE-IN EXPERIENCE AND CURRENTLY RESIDE IN NYC AREA. THANKS!

SUMMARY:
Seeking super responsible, well-educated nanny to care for 2 children during the week. Must be comfortable operating independently and taking charge as needed. Want a true collaborative child caregiver who can be fun and engaged for kids, but highly responsible and dependable and give guidance when appropriate. This is an active role.

SCHEDULE:
· We are looking for a live-in during the week. Arrive Monday morning by 7am and depart Friday evening at 6pm. Separate (truly) 
 private and spacious bedroom with ensuite bathroom provided.
· Nanny will have primary childcare responsibilities during the week, given both parents travel extensively for work (kids are in school for most of the day, so there is some down-time.)
· Hours are generally 7am to 7:30 pm (i.e., at 7:30pm, nanny can either put the kids to bed, or hand them off to parents if parents are home. Post 7:30 pm if a parent is home, the nanny is considered "off duty".)  This is strictly abided by.
· You have your own home to reside in on your weekend off days.
· No extra sitting will be asked on weekends, we have a weekend babysitter as needed.

MAIN DUTIES:
- Meal prep for kids only 
- Help the kids get ready in the morning for school and drop them off at schools
- Pick them up, take them to after-school activities, and later manage the night-time routine
- Do the children's laundry (no need to do adults' laundry)
- Help with basic homework
- Arrange and host playdates with school friends
- Clean up after the kids and keep their room, play areas, bathrooms, and kitchen clean and tidy (housekeeper comes weekly for deep clean.)
- Plan out what groceries are needed for the upcoming week and leave a shopping list for parents

ATTRIBUTES:
· College educated, with perfect spoken and written English, strong communication skills, polished and presentable
· Must be comfortable being the only adult home at times and managing the household on her own - incredibly reliable, trustworthy, organized and responsible with excellent judgement - takes great pride in her work
· Emotionally supportive, loving, consistently kind, and able to form a strong bond with the kids
· Calm and even tempered
· Outgoing and friendly
· Has significant experience with and likes working with older kids
· Energetic and young enough to keep up with active school-aged kids

SALARY / OTHER:
· Salary up to $1,100 take-home per week
· You are seeking family to work with long-term (several years +)
· Impeccable references. Expect that we will do our own background checks in addition to agency background checks
· National holidays and approx 4 weeks paid time off when family is away, prefer vacations taken then but open to other needs.

PLEASE RESPOND WITH COVER LETTER AND RESUME.
title: Seeking nanny live-in M - F

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Come join the Hurricane Express family as a company driver ..!

It's easy to apply online at www.hurricaneexpressinc.com or call 877-379-7383 ...!

•	$1,400 total per round trip
•	Includes non-taxable per diem
•	Each round trip will be 5-6 days and will include two or more loads
•	A round trip will generally consist of a load to AR/OK area followed by a return load to the NJ/NY area
•	Each round trip will take up to 70 hours per week (on duty and driving)
•	Drivers who live within a 100 mile radius of  Newark, NJ., would take their restart at home. They will need to have a safe and secure location to park the truck and trailer when home.  
•	All loads will potentially have multiple pickups and deliveries
•	2 weeks paid vacation available per calendar year
•	$550 quarterly safety bonuses available 
•	Must be available for dispatch immediately upon completion of 34 hour reset to earn $75,000 per year
•	Medical, dental and vision benefits available.

HIRING QUALIFICATIONS

•	Minimum Age 30 years old. Exception can be made if the driver is 28 years old, with 6 months average tenure and a clean driving record.
•	Minimum Tenure average of 3 months.
•	30 months of verifiable OTR Experience, with at least 6 months in the last 3 years.
•	DWI/DUI in a commercial vehicle is an automatic disqualification.
•	No DWI/DUI in the past 10 years.
•	No CDL drug or alcohol violations.
•	No robbery, drug, extortion or murder felonies. All other felonies are subject to review by Orientation Manager and Safety Director.
•	Review by Orientation Manager and Safety Director required if more than 4 driver violations, 2 from each category: 
•	HOS
•	Unsafe driving
•	Driver's License Suspensions
•	2 Inspections with more than 10 Violations (driver or equipment)
•	3 Overweight Violations

Regional Experience

•	30 months of verifiable OTR experience or a combination of 20 months OTR plus 10 months regional or local experience as defined below.
•	50% regional experience will be credited toward months of OTR experience
Example: a driver has 24 months of regional experience =12 months OTR equivalent experience
25% local, straight truck, dump truck, bus or wrecker 
•	Example: a driver has 12 months local experience = 3 months of OTR equivalent experience 

DAC review items

•	Drivers with more than one of the items listed below reported by a previous employer will be reviewed by Orientation Manager and Safety Director.
•	Unauthorized location with or without notice
•	Authorized Location with or without notice

It's easy to apply online at www.hurricaneexpressinc.com or call 877-379-7383 ...!

We are looking for service-oriented individuals to fill dispatcher and MOD positions at a corporate park at its location in Stamford, CT.   The positions are full-time with regular steady shifts. These positions would include both supervisory / MOD duties as well as dispatcher duties with occasional driving of a shuttle.  This is a gem of a job for the right candidate who wants stability and can be dependable as well.

Ideal candidates will have:
•	CDL Class B with Passenger Endorsement REQUIRED
•	Basic computer skills preferred, organization skills required

•	Strong Customer Service and communication Skills

Duties include:
•	Overseeing onsite staff to ensure operation continues flawlessly

Position Hours are Monday - Friday 3p-11p

We are seeking talented Line Cooks (both hot and cold line) for immediate hire at our highly regarded and popular Brooklyn Heights farm-to-table restaurant.

We are a progressive kitchen focused on creative American cooking with Italian influences--
emphasizing quality, seasonality, and a vegetable-forward approach. All applicants must have experience in fine dining and exposure to a variety of technique. You must be able to carefully serve and adhere to the fast pace of the work place.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
BARANO Restaurant is hiring for the Server position. 

We are a wood-fired seasonal Italian restaurant led by Chef Al Di Meglio and centered around the concept of refinement through simplicity. Chef Di Meglio's seasonal menus adapt old-world cooking techniques to modern tastes. BARANO is a company that is very passionate about well-executed and balanced food, raw and natural wines, craft cocktails, spirits, and rare beers.

We are hoping to find others that share these same passions and can then translate our passion to each of our guests. We use a global scale to meet the needs of our local community. By doing so, we hope to provide a unique experience for each guest that walks through our doors. 

Our restaurant is nestled in the in the amazingly diverse area of South Williamsburg which is currently one of the most rapidly developing areas in NYC with nearly 5,000 residential/commercial units being built within a 13 block radius from our restaurant alone. 

Servers must possess:

· Knowledge of Italian cuisine

· General knowledge of wines from all over the world, newer beer styles, and classic cocktails

· Refined but non-intrusive presence at the table/bar and ability to lead a service team

· A drive to continuously improve their service, knowledge, and experience

Ideal candidates:

· Are professional, articulate, friendly and punctual

· Have 2+ years of general FOH experience (fine dining experience is a plus)

· Have open availability on weekends

For consideration, please respond with a cover letter and resume. Please be sure to note the position you are applying for in the subject line.

We are open:

Monday 6:00PM-10:30PM 
Tuesday 6:00PM-10:30PM 
Wednesday 6:00PM-10:30PM 
Thursday 6:00PM-10:30PM 
Friday 6:00PM-12:00AM 
Saturday 5:00PM-12:00AM 
Sunday 11:30AM-3:30PM, 5:00PM-10:00PM

Full & part-time positions available.

*BARANO is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We look forward to hearing from you soon.
title: Experienced Servers Wanted - Barano Restaurant

We are currently seeking business contract carrier partners to service our client in the greater NY/NJ area for in home delivery of new furniture.

For top performers, your business can expect ongoing local deliveries, same daily loadout and check-in location, and potential of very high gross potential revenue for home delivery of new furniture in that market area. 

Business requirements to qualify as a carrier partner:

• Your business is incorporated and has an FEIN
• Your business owns 26-foot straight trucks
• Your business maintains general liability, umbrella, auto (liability, collision, comprehensive), cargo, and workers compensation insurance from A-rated carriers
• Your drivers have clean driving records, can pass criminal background checks and DOT drug screening, helper will also need to pass a background, do not need to take drug exam.

For more information please call Francisco at 201-556-8826

We are currently looking for experienced cooks to join our growing BOH team. Barano provides an excellent opportunity to grow and be part of a dynamic and ideal driven company. Cooks will be knowledgeable about food and excited to share their thoughts and ideas to help build our seasonal menu.  

Cooks will also be provided with thorough training and continued active education within the restaurant.  Cooks will be in direct contact with the Chef and Sous Chef. Cooks should be able to read and follow recipes and standards, help train new employees, maintain health department standards, and maintain food quality and restaurant standards.

-    Competitive wages

Brooklyn and Los Angeles. Our organic meal delivery program is based on the science behind a whole-
food, plant-rich diet. Each meal is nutritionally designed to contain the optimal amount of plant-based
protein, hydrating fresh produce and nutrient-dense superfoods to help balance, restore and heal the
body, so our clients can look and feel their absolute best.
We are currently seeking passionate, positive and hardworking team players to join our team. We are a
performance-based culture and reward hard work and exceptional results with competitive compensation
and opportunities for growth.

deadlines

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Socialminded Media Group provides social media and marketing management for small business and solopreneurs. Based in NYC. www.socialmindedmediagroup.com

JOB DESCRIPTION

Our ideal candidate is someone who walks into a room of people and can't leave without making a few friends. Someone who is obsessed with technology, apps, social media, and is creative and thoughtful when interacting with online communities and building relationships. You need to have a true love/passion of social media, understand the platforms and want to engage/learn more on them. You are on time, abide by deadlines, organized and ready to excel. The right person can transition into a paid position. 

This position will pay a small monthly stipend and/or as well as college credit. 

QUALIFICATIONS

- Must have experience running social media channels including Instagram (stories as well), Facebook (and Facebook live), Twitter and Snapchat.
- Must have experience in blogging and a love for writing.
- Must love to attend events and share on social live in person.
- Organized, with an ability to prioritize time-sensitive assignments.
- This is WORK-FROM-HOME position, but you must be able to meet in person once a week (sometimes will be in Astoria, Queens).
- Background in Marketing, Business, or Communication
- Strong communication and grammar skills.
- Proficient in Microsoft Suite Office.
- Has worked with Hootsuite and/or other social media management tools and apps.

What You Will Learn:

- How start-ups operate and grow
- How to create a long-term social media plan and marketing calendar.
- Relationship building with our online community by maintaining Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other media accounts.
- How to cultivate an online community
- How to track social media analytics using HootSuite and other software, and report results and new ideas to our marketing team.
- Create compelling content that will be shared by influencers.
- Create gorilla and viral marketing tactics
- Draft social content, blog entries, press releases, e-mail blasts and website copy.

**When applying, please include samples of prior social media channel management and writing samples online (can be a blog, prior publications, etc.). 

 Hiring Organization: Socialminded Media Group
title: Social Media + Blogging Intern
