body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
HOMENATURE - SALES & STOCK SUPPORT ASSOCIATE -- Full Time Seasonal (Southampton)

**********************************************

POSITION NEEDED:  SALES & STOCK SUPPORT ASSOCIATE -- Full Time Seasonal

COMPENSATION:  Salary

LOCATION:  Southampton, NY

COMPANY OVERVIEW:  
homenature is a high end custom furniture and home furnishings company. We are a fast growing home furnishings company originated in the Hamptons and is bringing the Hampton's style and vibe to life. Clean modern style with a selection of vintage mid-century modern furniture.  We love everything about honest design, natural materials, fair pricing and treating the earth with respect and care.

Website:   homenature.com


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

1.	Smile. Exhibit a friendly demeanor. Meet & greet every customer.
2.	Provide Sales Floor Coverage when needed during busy periods of associate breaks.
3.	Ringing basic Sales Transactions for customers in our POS system called STORIS
4.	Properly pack all customer's purchases for pickup to avoid breakage while items are being transported
5.	Support Design Associates when requested - tasks vary.
6.	Assisting with all floor moves - while managing the movement of furniture & accessories.
7.	Organization of Stockroom so that it is clean, orderly and well stocked.
8.	Maintaining inventory (both store & supplies).
9.	Maintaining interior and exterior appearance.
10.	Properly ticket all merchandise with price tags, signage and furniture tags.
11.	Creating, Receiving and Processing transfers & shipments in a timely manner.
12.	Sending transfers between locations & preparing pickup/transfer requests. 
13.	Ship all customer's purchases via our local UPS store. 
14.	Organize & Maintain "sold area" consisting of customer's purchases.
15.	Comply with company dress code and other company protocol.
16.	Demonstrate teamwork. Be prepared to assist all customers and fellow co-workers.
17.	Consistently communicate with the team and General Manager regarding shipments, arrivals and completion of all projects.
18.	Other duties as assigned.


SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS

Candidates should have a drive for success and desire to learn and grow. Hours for this position will include nights, weekends, and possible holidays.

1.	Ability to stand for up to 8 hours
2.	Ability to lift 50 lbs regularly and repeatedly
3.	Furniture delivery/assembly experience preferred
4.	Previous experience in inventory preferred
5.	Knowledge of Storis and/or Point of Sale and Inventory Systems preferred
6.	1-2 years of sales or stock experience preferred.
7.	Strong communication and presentation skills.
8.	Excellent time management skills.
9.	Exercise good judgement, partnering with co-workers & management as necessary.
10.	Ability to be an independent worker.

PLEASE only apply if you have the skills and experience required for the position.
title: HOMENATURE - SALES & STOCK SUPPORT ASSOCIATE -- Full Time Seasonal

7.	Strong communication and presentation skills.
8.	Excellent time management skills.
9.	Exercise good judgement, partnering with co-workers & management as necessary.
10.	Ability to be an independent worker.

PLEASE only apply if you have the skills and experience required for the position.
title: HOMENATURE - SALES & STOCK SUPPORT ASSOCIATE -- Full Time Seasonal

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
HOMENATURE - RETAIL SALES ASSOCIATE -- Full Time (Flatiron)

**********************************************

POSITION NEEDED:  Retail Sales Associate -- Full Time

COMPENSATION:  Base Salary + Commission

LOCATION:  New York, NY -- Flatiron

COMPANY OVERVIEW:  
homenature is a high end custom furniture and home furnishings company. We are a fast growing home furnishings company originated in the Hamptons and is bringing the Hampton's style and vibe to life. Clean modern style with a selection of vintage mid-century modern furniture.  We love everything about honest design, natural materials, fair pricing and treating the earth with respect and care.

Website:   homenature.com

QUALIFICATIONS:
*  2+ Years' experience in selling high end furniture either in a Retail Environment or Design Showroom.
*  Interior Design Experience Preferred

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
*  Smile. Exhibit a friendly demeanor. Meet and greet every customer.
*  Work with all potential customers, maintaining a composed, professional demeanor at all times. 
*  Demonstrate furniture sales savvy/knowledge/experience/expertise when conversing with customers. Stay current and aware of industry trends.
*  Provide superior service during the sale process, while working to close the sale. Complete accurate order processing, provide all required pre and post-sale follow through. 
*  Properly process and complete sales order paperwork and all supporting documentation (i.e. completing COM/COL forms, designer registrations, resale/tax ID forms, etc.). Utilize the POS system, general computer programs and other necessary tools.
*  Be prepared to communicate accurate status updates to customers. These updates may include communicating order delay updates.
*  Cultivate a strong client base via relationship building and networking.
*  Provide product knowledge and ensure the customer is comfortable with their purchase(s). Exhibit the know-how necessary to close sales.
*  Be knowledgeable about homenature merchandise. Accurately advise customers on warranties, cleaning recommendations and general product care. 
*  Ensure that all potential and current customers experience the company's excellent customer service.
*  Be comfortable performing in home consultations, working with clients in their homes, providing design direction and creating floor plans using products offered by homenature.
*  Provide quick and accurate responses to email and phone inquiries, within 24 hours of initial contact. 
*  Take initiative, working to achieve/exceed set goals. Perform outreach, building brand awareness to members of the design community and customers at large.
*  Complete store opening and closing responsibilities, including routine sales floor recovery throughout the day. It is the responsibility to all employees to ensure the sales floor looks its best at all times.
*  Comply with company dress code and other company protocol.
*  Attend weekly one on one meetings with management. Be prepared to discuss current sales/quotes, strategize business opportunities and discuss missed opportunities.
*  Demonstrate teamwork. Be prepared to assist all customers and fellow co-workers. Routinely be willing to assist/train new members of the sales team.
*  Clearly and accurately communicate with customers and co-workers. Always set appropriate/realistic expectations.
*  Exercise good judgment, partnering with colleagues and management as necessary.
*  Must be able to work some evening, weekends & holidays

ASSOCIATE BENEFITS:
Exceptional Advancement Opportunities
Competitive Earnings with Bonus Opportunities
Generous Employee Discount
Medical Insurance
Paid Vacations & Holidays

PLEASE only apply if you have the skills and experience required for the position.

QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We are looking for experienced Store Managers and Assistant Store Managers for our small format retail stores located in Bronx and Brooklyn NYC, candidate should be highly organized, know how to priority, understand financial expenses like payroll, a P&L statement, and markdowns.   Will be dedicated to training of store management staff in addition to store hourly staff.  Will be proficient on shrink reduction and what are the causes of shrink in a retail setting, and how to control overall. Will have developed follow up skills and know how to hold their staff accountable for results and direction. Will have a high understanding of inventory management and great merchandising skills.  Will have high standards for customer service, daily recovery, store presentation, store cleanliness inside and outside of store, timely execution of company initiatives, like price changes, plano-grams, & seasonal sections set up and consolidated as the different seasons wind down. Able to engage with meaningful conversation with District Manager, Regional Manager & Executive leadership.  Will know how to analyze different reports, and make informed decisions to drive results and performance.  Will be a team player and assist within the District & the Region as assignments are presented.  This is a fortunate 150 company with excess 20,000 locations throughout the US, has in excess of 60 location in NYC alone, and is planned to double that number in the short term.   For further consideration please forward your resume with clear contact information to dfernandez2018@outlook.com

Reinforcing ironworker? NYC's reinforcing ironwork union local is one of America's busiest, and we expect to continue to be busy for several years. 

Apply now to ensure that when our employers need more people than we have in our membership, we know your skills and how to reach you. 

Our members receive very good pay. Our health and welfare and defined benefit pension plans are employer-paid. And we always work safe!

We welcome applications from men and women ironworkers and apprentices who are currently working for non-union employers. We always work safe! 

Come work with the industry's best!

TO APPLY: http://www.ironjobs.org

From the James Beard Award-winning team behind Maison Premiere & Sauvage, the Golden Hour now seeks qualified candidates for full time professional cooks (Line/Prep Cooks, Oyster Shuckers). The position is seasonal, with an opening date estimated around mid May to a closing date of late-October.

Inspired by the coastal outdoor dining of the North Atlantic, the Golden Hour will feature equal parts travel and local: soft shell crab-on-rye, the Clambake, and its unctuous sides of roasted corn and crab confit. double-stack burger, baked Quahogs, and all the other memories of pilgrimages to the coast. The Golden Hour will also have an extensive Raw Bar Program.

We are committed to unique, respectfully sourced and harvested products, and are technique driven. We are seeking individuals who are committed to excellence and working at the highest levels! Be expected to work weekends and holidays.

Thank you!

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We are looking for experienced candidates to join our dynamic and growing team. 

We are a unique restaurant offering Southern food and warm hospitality. Our philosophy is simply put to care for employees and nurture our guests, while maintaining a welcoming environment. We pride ourselves in making a commitment to our community, while developing strong relationships with local farmers and purveyors. 

We will be hosting open calls Monday - Friday from 12 PM to 5 PM!
 
Bussers:
Candidates should be experienced with high-volume. 
- Representing our brand so it's imperative to exceed our guests' expectations. 
- Must know how to work with position numbers 
- Works to orchestrate a "Jacob's Pickles" experience-premium yet comfortable and charming. 
- Great approach with our guests; must go above and beyond to make sure our guests leaves with a smile.
- A master of the menu-knows it inside and out
- Precisely organizing, preparing a neat work area, with ease of execution.
- Following and complying NYCHD and company sanitation standards.
- Great multi-tasker, and excellence in listening and communication. 
- Dress code-wears uniform as prescribed by company standards (current aprons, Jacob's t-shirt, dark blue jeans, black socks and comfortable but professional black footwear)
- Maintain a safe, hazard-free work environment within area of responsibility
- Flexible schedule and available to work weekends and holidays 

Please come to Jacob's Pickles at 509 Amsterdam Ave, Monday through Friday between the hours of 12 PM and 5 PM. Please bring a hard copy of your resume. We will not accept any resumes with photos on them.

If you cannot make our open call, please email a copy of your resume and we will set up a time for you come in and interview. We do not accept any resumes with photos or photo attachments.

Compensation is commensurate with experience.

We thank you in advance for sending your resume, and although we may not respond to every e-mail; we truly appreciate your inquiry.

We are an equal opportunity employer.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Come join the Hurricane Express family as a company driver ..!

It's easy to apply online at www.hurricaneexpressinc.com or call 877-379-7383 ...!

•	$1,400 total per round trip
•	Includes non-taxable per diem
•	Each round trip will be 5-6 days and will include two or more loads
•	A round trip will generally consist of a load to AR/OK area followed by a return load to the NJ/NY area
•	Each round trip will take up to 70 hours per week (on duty and driving)
•	Drivers who live within a 100 mile radius of  Newark, NJ., would take their restart at home. They will need to have a safe and secure location to park the truck and trailer when home.  
•	All loads will potentially have multiple pickups and deliveries
•	2 weeks paid vacation available per calendar year
•	$550 quarterly safety bonuses available 
•	Must be available for dispatch immediately upon completion of 34 hour reset to earn $75,000 per year
•	Medical, dental and vision benefits available.

HIRING QUALIFICATIONS

•	Minimum Age 30 years old. Exception can be made if the driver is 28 years old, with 6 months average tenure and a clean driving record.
•	Minimum Tenure average of 3 months.
•	30 months of verifiable OTR Experience, with at least 6 months in the last 3 years.
•	DWI/DUI in a commercial vehicle is an automatic disqualification.
•	No DWI/DUI in the past 10 years.
•	No CDL drug or alcohol violations.
•	No robbery, drug, extortion or murder felonies. All other felonies are subject to review by Orientation Manager and Safety Director.
•	Review by Orientation Manager and Safety Director required if more than 4 driver violations, 2 from each category: 
•	HOS
•	Unsafe driving
•	Driver's License Suspensions
•	2 Inspections with more than 10 Violations (driver or equipment)
•	3 Overweight Violations

Regional Experience

•	30 months of verifiable OTR experience or a combination of 20 months OTR plus 10 months regional or local experience as defined below.
•	50% regional experience will be credited toward months of OTR experience
Example: a driver has 24 months of regional experience =12 months OTR equivalent experience
25% local, straight truck, dump truck, bus or wrecker 
•	Example: a driver has 12 months local experience = 3 months of OTR equivalent experience 

DAC review items

•	Drivers with more than one of the items listed below reported by a previous employer will be reviewed by Orientation Manager and Safety Director.
•	Unauthorized location with or without notice
•	Authorized Location with or without notice

It's easy to apply online at www.hurricaneexpressinc.com or call 877-379-7383 ...!
title: Company Drivers! GET HOME OFTEN..! $75,000 PER YEAR GUARANTEED..!

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Part-Time Administrative Assistant 

New York businessperson  seeks sharp personal assistant with exceptional communication and organizational skills!
	
Job Responsibilities:
Candidate will be actively involved performing personal and administrative duties including:
 - Office organization and maintenance
 - Book-keeping, record-keeping
 - Paper and digital filing
 - Administration of personal affairs (bills, health care, etc.)
 - Occasional errands for family
 - Handle confidential communications/correspondence
 - Oversee scheduling, family calendar, travel arrangements, etc.
 - Oversee home projects
 - Maintain efficiency of home technology network (internet connection, phones, computer backup, email, etc)

The job may include research on projects and some light financial modeling.

Job Requirements:
Candidate must be task-oriented, energetic self-starter, proactive and pleasant, with strong verbal and written skills. Must be able to work independently, manage several ongoing tasks at once, and have excellent follow-through. Bachelor's degree or relevant prior work experience required, and administrative experience is a plus. Required computer skills: must be proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and be able to troubleshoot occasional home-office/network computer issues that may arise. Knowledge of current technology/apps a plus. Must have a valid driver's license. 

Office Location:
Home office on upper Westside (70's); may also upon occasion work out of midtown business office. 

Employment Hours/ Rate:
Part-Time (about 25 hrs/week, working 3 days a week)
$20/hr

Please submit all resumes with a cover letter via email with the subject line "2018 Assistant Inquiry." Applications without this subject line will not be considered.

All resumes will be handled with the utmost confidence.
title: New York businessperson seeks sharp personal assistant

  About EF English First


EF English First is the world's leading privately owned education company. Founded in 1965, EF operates in over 50 countries around the world. We have vacancies for teaching positions across China so if you prefer the fast paced city life like Shanghai, or want to be immersed in the more traditional culture of a smaller city, we probably have the position for you. We have both Kids & Teens schools and Adult schools in over 60 Cities in China.


  We would love to meet you, if you:


Have a Bachelor's degree
Want to live abroad for at least one year
Have a clear background
Have a TEFL certification (You don't? Don't worry, we offer free sponsorship)



  
   
    
     
    
  
  
    "At EF, we tend to share the same sense of adventure and community. We talk about new places to visit and things to do. Being a teacher is not a desk job. body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
The James Beard Award winning bar in Williamsburg, Maison Premiere, is currently hiring experienced and charismatic FOH staff -  Servers, Hosts, Barback, Food Runner and Backwaiter to join our expanding team.

We are looking for candidates with a genuine appreciation for the hospitality business, a professional work ethic.

Server must possess a genuine hospitality, eager to learn a broad knowledge of seafood, wine and spirits, follow the steps of service and carries a positive demeanor while under pressure. 

Host position must have polished appearance and a poised and welcoming demeanor are essential. 

Barback position must be able to assist the bartender and can deliver at the highest level especially during the peak hours.

Food Runner must have the willingness to expand their interest on seafood and has a strong communication skills between the FOH and BOH departments.

Backwaiter position requires the ability to assist servers in every step of service and maintain the needs of the guests and the restaurant as a whole. 

Candidates must have a sincere desire to make guests feel at home and a non-stop drive to deliver outstanding service. Fine dining experience is preferred and a polished appearance is required. Great communication skills is required on all departments!

A keen interest in craft cocktails, absinthe, wine, oysters, and seafood, plus an eagerness to learn more are important. We are looking for candidates that will passionately embody our brand, vision, and high level of hospitality, and act as ambassadors to our food and beverage programs.

The work is fast paced and offers a great opportunity to expand your knowledge of seafood and cocktails.
We are committed to unique, respectfully sourced and harvested products, and are technique driven. We are seeking individuals who are committed to excellence and working at the highest levels! Be expected to work weekends and holidays.

We are interested in hiring candidates with open availability, including weekends and holidays, for both brunch and dinner shifts. 

Please email us telling us why you would make a great addition to our team and paste your resume in the body of the email. In the subject line of the email, please write the position you are applying for.

Thank you for your interest on joining our team!
title: Hiring All FOH Staff at Maison Premiere

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
At Pinkberry we believe in only delivering uncompromising service and high quality work; we take great care and time in finding the right fit in joining the Pinkberry team. We believe in the power of human connection, teamwork, and that our people are the difference in our customers experience each day. 

Our dynamic work environment requires a passion for the business, a passion for the customer, and a passion for excellence. If you are someone who believes that every moment with a customer is an opportunity to create a genuine emotional connection, and you enjoy being a part of a team-inspired organization with a callting to create happiness, then this is your chance to become a part of the culture that is Pinkberry.
 
We are looking for General Managers / Shift Leaders to lead a customer-focused team to passionately deliver a one-of-a-kind Pinkberry experience while achieving sales and profit growth. 



Inspired by European gelato, America's ice cream pastime and pop culture, Pinkberry is designed to create a social experience that indulges the senses. Pinkberry's proprietary recipes are a uniquely refreshing combination of tastes and textures, harmonizing distinctive flavors with the signature Pinkberry yogurt tang. 

Pinkberry is fast becoming an iconic brand name for the yogurt category. Pinkberry has created an exceptionally strong emotional connection with customers and currently has more than 150 stores throughout California, New York, Texas and internationally in Kuwait and Dubai.



Job Summary

The General Manager is responsible for the operations of assigned stores, which includes, but is not limited to
* High level customer service 
* Management of team members
* Inventory
* Maintenance
* Sales performance
* Yogurt production.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.  Other duties may be assigned by management. 
Ensures proper hiring, orientation, training, evaluating, mentoring and disciplining team members to maintain a productive and successful environment for both team members and customers. 
Motivates, teaches and develops team by taking initiative and delivering outstanding customer service; leads SWIRL + Connect philosophy by example.
Determines both customer's and team members' needs and prepare strategies to improve store performance. 
Manages the store appearance, maintenance and atmosphere. 
Ensures timely personnel scheduling/shift cut backs to facilitate standard coverage and efficiency. 
Delivers operational standards effectively to team members through meetings. 
Produces and operates strategies to improve operational and financial performance. 
Consistently controls food and labor costs. 
Builds and maintains store security and a safe working environment for employees and customers. 
Effectively and professionally communicates with guests, supervisors, team members, vendors and owner/operators. 
Ability to lead, guide and motivate team members and owner operators through a wide variety of training methods; able to explain operations and operating procedures concisely and clearly. 
Meets the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers through service improvement.  Acts through a customer relationship lens; able to maintain effective relationships with customers by gaining trust and respect.  
Able to create a team willing to provide top-notch customer service with service ability, quality and emotional connections. 
This position is with  a franchisee of Pinkberry. 

Job Requirements
* 3 years of quick service restaurant experience. 
* Health Department Certified 
* Strong organizational and time management skills.  
* At least three years supervising, developing and leading team members to success.  Able to bring high performing talent to next level within organization. 
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with all types of people. 
* Proven track record of controlling costs. 
* Ability to lead a team to achieve goals. 
* Proven track record of having excellent customer service values.  
* Must be innovative in making changes to the operation in order to further improve the working environment and service to customers. 
* Professional platform skills are required for facilitating training programs.  Must be able to maintain and control direction of training and/or training classes.  Must be able to incorporate issues brought up in class into lessons for that day.   
* Ability to work varied shifts & days of the week 
* Has a "drive for results" attitude 
* Likes to have fun 





If you possess ALL the characteristics listed above, don't wait; send us your email to hr-east@cspbholdings.com attention Shawana Clark for consideration. Please indicate the position for which you are applying and your recent salary history for consideration. . 


Please DO NOT contact the stores. We will be reviewing your resume and we will contact you for further discussion!



CSPB Holdings is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The position is a Payroll Support Specialists, with prior experience in Payroll and Time & Labor processing.

We are looking for individuals with world class customer service skills, including excellent rapport building, phone & listening skills and time management. Day-to-day activities will include assisting customers with our Payroll/Time & Labor platform, ensuring accuracy, timeliness and providing support with other payroll related matters.

The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of prior experience in payroll and/or benefits administration.

The position requires a detail-oriented, solution-driven individual, who is able to operate sometimes under pressure, while remaining calm and maintaining a positive demeanor.

Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
* Train customers to use the platform
* Assist customers in entering and processing payroll
* Produce various payroll related reports when requested
* Ensure timely and effective resolution for payroll related matters

As the saying goes, "When you've got it up, keep it up!" And after 10 years of making some of NYC's best wood-fired foods, we've got it up. Now we're looking for the right person to help us keep it up - could it be you?

Pizza Moto is a dynamic restaurant business with lots going on. We're a business built from whole cloth by talented, creative cooks with seasoned restaurant chops who's mission is to take care of our family, amaze our guests and above all, keep it interesting and fun!

We're looking for someone who is ready to spread their wings creatively, detail oriented, ready to take the reigns and be a part of a great team of professionals.   We are hungry for new ideas from you and an energy that will allow us to keep growing and learning. If you've got a fire in the belly, and love engaging work, making dishes that are delicious and maybe even a little ahead of the times, this will be a great fit. The wood fired oven is massive and a blast to use, the options are endless. Our menu is ever changing with the seasons and we work hard to feature only produce and ingredients that are the best. We are so much more than pizza - we make our own ice creams, sourdough bread, and even smoke trout up in here. 

The Chef's schedule is 5 days a week, roughly 45 hours and we offer a week's paid vacation in the first year! 

Get in touch with a short note about your interest in this position and we'll get right back to you!

Applicants will be invited in for an interview, a trail  and asked to do some cooking to dazzle us. 

We hope to hear from you and look forward to finding our missing link!

Yours in pizza
Dave

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
We are looking to bring 2 new people into our family! Fun work environment for the right person.

1st position is someone who can wear a few different hats: Expo, Busser, and Barback.
2nd position is: A strong and experienced Bartender, who doesn't mind working serving shifts here and there. 

Expo/ Barback position: 
Must be reliable: you are our only expo/ barback so we need you to be available every Friday and Saturday night. 
(We might need you for Thursday's in the future)
Must have experience working in the kitchen calling out orders when it's busy. 
We are looking for someone who can stay organized, keep the kitchen on task, address any errors in a friendly manner, keep a smile on your face, be helpful at all times, and look out for consistency in the food presentation. 
After the kitchen closes you will transition into the position of Barback, helping stock the bar, getting ice, whatever the bartenders need. 
This position will involve heavy lifting and standing on your feet for long periods of time. 

Bartender position:
Must be reliable and responsible: Be available to work your shifts and arrive on time. Ideally, we want someone who lives in Astoria.
Must have experience in fast paced bars, know how to make the classics, ability to stay on task and keep cool under pressure.  
Must have a friendly positive disposition. 
Ability to develop relationships with regulars.
We believe and practice PMA. 
Please be okay with working serving shifts, and be okay working shifts on your own where you do it all (run, bus, serve, and bartend). 
Drama free and must have a teamwork mentality.
3 shifts available.

PLEASE MAKE SURE TO: Include your resume in the body of your email, put the position in the subject line, tell us a little something about yourself! what do you do in your free time? what kind of music are you into? 

We are really looking for someone who lives either in Astoria or Queens. 

WHO WE ARE: A small staff who acts like a family, we all help each other out when necessary. We are open minded and creative people, we believe in an inclusive future, and you should be all of these things too!

We are a general merchandise wholesale distributor company located in Westchester County, NY. We are supplying over 2500 different products such as ;

- Brand name cleaning products and accessories
- Personal, baby and women hygienic care products 
- Medicines, ointments and other similar products
- Packaging products and fast food accessories
- Paper products ( toilet tissue, paper towels, napkins etc )
- Candies, gums, chocolates, energy drinks etc.
- Hotel guest supplies 
- Auto supplies such as oil, lubricants car fresheners and accessories
- Textile and  seasonal products ( hats, gloves, baseball caps, socks, tshirts, sunglasses, umbrellas etc )
- Tobacco accessories & electronic cigarettes
- Stationary products
- Hardware products

for deli and grocery stores, convenient stores, gas station markets, hotels and building managements. Position is full time Monday thru Friday 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Saturday up to 3:00 pm. You MUST own your car and non suspended driver`s licence. Warehouse is in Westchester so forexample if you live and pick Queens and Long island areas then you don`t need to come to warehouse everyday. 

We are looking for an sales representative with experience in the following areas :

Area 1 : Queens, Long Island locations 
Area 2 : Westchester, Dutches, Rockland, Putnam and Orange counties
Area 3 : Bronx, Manhattan 
Area 4 : New Jersey 
Area 5 : Connecticut 

Candidates should have at least 2 year sales experience in the field. Please provide information which area you are interested to work when you apply. 

Your duties are ;
- Checking store shelves with customer and taking their weekly orders
- Introducing the new products and informing about promotions and flyers. ( Flyers, new items list and your own catalog will be provided )
- Set up meetings and visiting potential clients to introduce our company and products and you should have ambitious to start business with them
- Sending daily orders to the warehouse. 

You must be :
- Enjoying in selling and achieve goals
- Energetic, positive attitude and communication, motivated to be successful.
- Customer oriented, honest, patience with smiley face
- Excellent oral and written communication skills in English ( Spanish is a plus but not a must )
- Legally authorized to work in the U.S.

Benefits :
- Weekly base Salary + commission ( Commissions are increased based on sales levels ) 
- Certain amount lunch pay
- Paid vacation ( base salary after 1 year ) 
- Engine oil, car lubricants, inspection, parking, toll fees will be paid ( except traffic tickets )

We are looking for serious applicants. if you are available, experienced for this position and ready to answer the call to set up appointment then please Apply Now.

Did you just buy health insurance through Healthcare.gov or directly through a health plan? If so, we would love to have you participate in our 15 minute online research questionnaire. This research study will help us advocate for consumers like you, as we work with health plans across the U.S. and the government to implement cost efficient plans that you can actually use.


ABOUT THE RESEARCH STUDY

We're looking for individuals who have purchased health insurance for 2018 during open enrollment. You may also qualify if you have valid health insurance and are shopping for a new plan. Here's what you need to qualify for the research study:


----> You bought insurance through your state exchange, Healthcare.gov, through a broker, or directly through a health plan like Oscar, Kaiser, Blue Cross, etc. 

----> You don't receive your health insurance through an employer.

----> You currently have this health insurance active.

----> You are not on Medicaid, Medicare or VA health insurance.

----> You don't receive your health insurance through your school/university.

If this is you - we'd love to get your opinion! We will compensate qualified participants $50 cash through your preferred payment method. Please be advised that you will need to verify that you meet the qualifications above to be a part of our research study. 

If you meet the requirements above, please begin the research study here: 
https://joany.com/research_study?referral=westNY&pmt=50
__________________________________________________________


WHO WE ARE

Joany is a national organization with a mission to make health insurance simple and transparent. We are advocates for consumers, and experts in the health care industry, aiming to help consumers buy insurance they can actually use. Using data + predictive modeling, we have aggregated every single health plan offered across the U.S. into our web platform. Consumers can now shop for insurance without bouncing around website to website. Most importantly, we do the number crunching and analysis equivalent to 10 healthcare & finance experts in the background so you can receive a truly unbiased recommendation of the best plan for you. Since we are consumer advocates, our service is free to consumers. To learn more about us, please visit https://www.joany.com

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        

		
	
	
		
			PATINA RESTAURANT GROUP 
			seeks Steward Manager for Lincoln Ristorante
		
		
			Patina Restaurant Group, a bi-coastal boutique company, continues to grow as a leader in the premium segment of the restaurant industry! Boasting approximately 80 restaurants and hospitality venues in performing arts centers, Patina Restaurant Group offers outstanding career opportunities for talented & highly motivated professionals who have an eye for detail and an appreciation for the exceptional quality and level of service they stand for.  
		
			Patina Restaurant Group is passionately involved with the preservation and promotion of America's great cultural centers.  Our family of restaurants are aligned with unique architectural landmarks and cultural institutions that strive to enrich the American experience through fine arts, dance, music, theatre and performance. PRG operates exciting restaurants in world famous locations: from Lincoln Ristorante at Lincoln Center to the Sea Grill at Rockefeller Center; timeless spaces like the Michelin-starred Patina at Walt Disney Concert Hall, or fresh new collaborations like Morimoto Asia or Chef Street in Macy's Herald Square - our restaurants offer the finest in artisanal culinary inspirations. 
		
		
			THE OPPORTUNITY:
		
			At Lincoln Ristorante, we offer Chef Shea Gallante's interpretation of Italian cuisine in New York at Lincoln Center. Our philosophy is simple: to source the best local ingredients and prepare them with authentic Italian methods and spirit. We rely on local farmers and purveyors along with weekly visits to our neighborhood Tucker Square Greenmarket, while importing irreplaceable items from Italy. We honor the Italian culinary tradition of making our own fresh pastas, grissini, and focaccia. Desserts, by Richard Capizzi, are beautiful renditions of Italy's classics: light, lush and irresistible. A focus and commitment to freshness and respect for every ingredient is paramount in our daily life.
		
			While our location beside Lincoln Center's reflecting pool and Henry Moore sculpture is exquisite, with panoramic views and a grass lawn roof, the heart of our restaurant is the central open kitchen. The stunning glass pavilion building that houses the restaurant was designed by Diller, Scofidio + Renfro. Our Negroni Bar and Prosecco Bar have rotating selections. Wine Director Aaron von Rock and his team offer 350 wines on the list, constantly evolving and focused on small producers.
		
			Our role in the Lincoln Center community is to provide a gracious fine dining experience that reflects the best of both Italy and New York. Our mission would be impossible without our talented restaurant team of dedicated culinary and hospitality professionals who embody this world-class dining experience. Patina Restaurant Group is seeking similarly passionate individuals to share in this vocation with us. We are dedicated to facilitating growth and development of our employees' careers in all fields.
		
		
			THE POSITION SUMMARY:
		
			Steward Manager
		
			Patina Restaurant Group is seeking for a back of house professional to position as Steward Manager. This individual will receive, maintain, store, and conduct quality control for all front and back of the house restaurant supplies. He/she will accept all deliveries, check invoices, document deliveries, inspect goods and report quality and quantity, place the goods in their designated areas, and monitor inventory of storage areas and inside the kitchen. Steward Managers must ensure that all deliveries are timely and received according to company and restaurant safety and quality standards. The ideal candidate possesses strong food knowledge and organizational skills. This representative will be the direct supervisor of subordinate stewarding staff responsible for hiring, training, and motivating their stewarding team. Other BOH duties may include ordering and coordinating food supplies and beverage and performing quality-control checks on deliveries, ensuring all necessary equipment is running, supervising kitchen and cleaning staff, and ensuring that health code regulations and liquor laws are obeyed.
		
			With these responsibilities come unlimited opportunities to grow as a supervisory professional with Patina Restaurant Group's friendly and enjoyable work environment and healthy work life balance.
		
		
			THE RESPONSIBILITIES: 
		
			
				Supervise and lead the duties of all stewarding department employees, maintain facilities, conduct necessary kitchen operations, and monitor costs.
			
				Receive and process all unit orders and deliveries according to company protocol. 
			
				Ensure Back of House areas and operations are maintained to the highest sanitary and quality standards, assuring cleaning schedules are followed and completed.
			
				Work closely with the Chef, Banquet and Catering Managers, and various departments to anticipate guest needs and ensure items that are required for service are available when needed.
			
				Facilitate banquet plate-ups and buffet arrangements by transporting and ensuring adequate stock; mobilize necessary transportation and set-up staff.
			
				Co-ordinate with the restaurant managers to check their supply, orders, and or operations required for the day and the next day.
			
				Enforce proper cleaning routines for service ware, equipment, floors, dish room machinery, etc; ensure compliance with food handling and sanitation standards.
			
				Monitor supplies and submit monthly reports on shortages in china silverware and equipment and requisition replacements as required while following budget guidelines; ensure necessary items are ordered in a timely manner.
			
				Ensure all food holding and transport equipment is in working order.
		
		
		
			THE QUALIFICATIONS:
		
			
				High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required.
			
				Minimum 3 years' experience in a managerial stewarding position or related back of house position with supervisory responsibilities in a full service high-volume restaurant, hotel, or other food and beverage unit with similar capacity and clientele.
			
				Strong financial and computer skills; has experience working with and an understanding of P&L's.
			
				Servsafe, Food Safety Handler, and Training for Intervention Procedures (TIPS) certification required.  
			
				Able to effectively mobilize back of house staff as needed. 
		
		
		
			Interested & Qualified individuals  click here
			 to apply.
		
		
			We're looking for a highly motivated career-focused individual with the ability to exceed our guests' expectations to become part of the winning team at the Patina Restaurant Group EOE. PRG employees enjoy competitive compensation packages, major medical insurance options, paid vacations, matching 401K programs, and exciting company dining rewards.   We are more than just an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status. Patina Restaurant Group enthusiastically celebrates the powerful and profound diversity of our team. We believe that talent, drive, and experience are the only relevant criteria for considering new team members.
title: LINCOLN RISTORANTE seeks Steward Manager!

We are a lively ramen joint looking for amazing cooks to join our team. We believe in working hard, having fun, and treating each other well. We use the best ingredients, have the most expansive menu of any ramen house in New York, and have wonderful service--it's no wonder how we've inspired a cult following! You know that teamwork is what makes a kitchen run efficiently and are always happy to help because no task is too small.

You believe that cleanliness is godliness and would never dream of using your phone while working because that's gross.

You leave your ego and your drama at the door because you're a professional and don't bring that into the workplace. Ever.

High fives. Lots of high fives.
